What are the benefits of steaming?
Steaming, a cooking technique that does not kill the vitamins and minerals in food, is becoming increasingly popular.
Steaming, one of the most preferred cooking methods in the Far East for centuries, strengthens metabolism and facilitates digestion.
This method also completely eliminates problems such as indigestion, and it also completely kills bacteria and microbes present in food.
The protein, cellulose and starch in the food is completely dissolved by this method and this makes the food softer.
Steaming, which takes place at low pressure, is carried out in pans or in a pressure cooker inside a pot.
In high-pressure cooking, the amount of water used and the cooking time is minimal.
The best example of this is cooking in a pressure cooker.
It is necessary to wash the vegetables well, especially those that are included in diet menus, and then wait for them to be drained in a strainer.
A deep pot is filled with one-third water and a steamer is placed inside the pot.
The mouth of the pot is left half open.
This allows the steam to easily escape from the pot.
The fire is first brought up to its highest level to bring the water to a boil, and then it is brought down to a lower level to maintain a steady heat.
Vegetables and foods which are cooked in steam for about 10-15 minutes are checked by using a fork after they are properly cooked.
The cooked vegetables are taken off the stove and placed on plates and then served.
In the steaming cooking technique, the appearance, color and smell of the food do not change, therefore this method is healthy.
The distinctive taste of the food remains the same.
In this way, the quality and taste of the food is not impaired.
In steam cooking, which is also one of the most economical cooking methods, food loss is kept to a minimum.
Steamed vegetables offer a feast of satisfaction to the eater with their lively and lively appearance.
This method, which is frequently used especially in diet foods, is frequently preferred because it is light.
David Bowie - Blackstar: The Alien's "last" album
Knowing that you will die; making that last album without telling anyone, turning your deathbed into an artistic area of expression in the video you made...
Such work may seem too “far-out” for us ordinary mortals.
I call them worldlings because I am among those who wholeheartedly believe that the man who did this was both immortal and alien.
He had come to our world from another corner of the universe, and now he was returning to his homeland; that was all.
He came because there was an inspiration that should be given to all artists in the World, not only to Kiss, Marilyn Manson or Lady Gaga.
He completed his duty properly.
David Bowie, Blackstar, iTunes price: 9.99 TL 5/5
He drew inspiration from Warhol and Kubrick, who are likely from the same planet.
When Apollo 11 landed on the moon, he decided to say "Is this a thing? I am an alien" and he joined us by saying "Space Oddity".
Actually, he didn't get mixed up; he always went several steps ahead.
Many people found the path they had lost thanks to him.
Both musician and listener...
If we put aside his interest in plastic arts and acting, it would be unfair to say that "It was only music" for his music.
In my opinion, his discography is an artistic unity with its variety of characters, references, and innovations that breaks the taboos.
I can neither call him the ancestor of glam rock nor the cousin of the punk...
What will happen to the jazz, which he has loved since childhood, if he leans so much towards avant-garde electronic movements?
David Bowie kept reminding us of what the word 'icon' actually means before we got used to saying it.
It was not male; it was not female; it was not human.
They were one body.
He appeared to us for a while on a mission.
That body left this world just two days after the release of his 26th studio album "Blackstar".
"Blackstar" and "Lazarus", which we listened to before the album was released, tried to adapt us to where we were going.
We thought "He is getting older and talking about death" but he was aware of everything.
One last game...

Apart from the fantastic "Blackstar" and "Lazarus", which carry the message and feelings of the album, we can say that we knew four songs when the album was released, including the "Sue (Or In A Season Of Crime)", which was published much earlier, but re-recorded for this album.
I would like to say that the remaining songs, "Girl Loves Me", "I Can't Give Everything Away" and "Dollar Days", are all very good songs.
Blackstar is based on a strong musical structure, but as a whole, it is quite sincere, like it is made with instantaneous feelings.
Neither death nor a "confrontation with the past" album ...
Just a real "final" album.
The End of a masterful music life.
Turkey was targeted in the Sultanahmet attack.

Holger Münch, head of the German Federal Criminal Police Office, made statements about the attack that took place on Tuesday in Sultanahmet Square and claimed the lives of 10 German citizens in a program on the first German channel ARD.
Münch said that the target of the attack was not German citizens, but Turkey.
"400 PEOPLE UNDER SURVEILLANCE"
However, Münch said that the Sultanahmet attack did not change the terrorism threat in Germany, and said, "We are still under a threat that should be taken seriously."
Münch says that there has been a decline in the number of people going to Syria from Germany to join ISIS, and points out that a large number of people have returned from war zones.
Münch says that it is a huge challenge from the perspective of security units, and said that "there are nearly 400 dangerous people that we cannot keep under surveillance."
Münch called for improved coordination among police services in Europe and for closer communication.

Turkish authorities have said the suicide bomber who carried out the attack was a Syrian citizen and a member of ISIS, while the German Interior Minister Thomas de Maiziere stated that the identity of the attacker has not been determined yet.

There is a 25 kuruş increase in the price of bread in Ankara and Istanbul.
In Ankara, as of yesterday, 250 gram of bread was increased by 25 kurus and it was sold for 1 TL.

The Chamber of Trades Union determined this tariff two years ago.
A price that is applied throughout Turkey.
So, a new price request was not brought up and the price was not increased.
But due to competition, shopkeepers in some districts of Ankara were selling it for 75 kurus.
In some regions, it was already being sold for 1 TL.

There is no increase or rise.
They apply the unapplied price.

ISIS has abandoned Whatsapp and is now communicating with the Alrawi application.
According to a new report, the terrorist organization ISIS is using its own chat tool to communicate independently of messaging apps such as WhatsApp and Telegram.
According to the Defense One report, the organization is using a new messaging app to communicate among themselves.
This Android app, called Alrawi, is distributed and installed via an APK file.
The application allows the organization to exchange encrypted messages and share media among themselves.
A sudden move by ISIS in Iraq
According to Ghost Security Group, the app's functionality is "primitive" compared to popular apps such as WhatsApp and Telegram.
The strength of the encryption used is not currently known.
Previously, ISIS had been carrying out its communications via the Telegram app, which allows all communications to be sent via encrypted links.
However, Telegram had uncovered channels where ISIL members were talking.
Furthermore, the US administration is demanding that app developers install backdoors into their apps.
That is why the organization has begun using its own solutions rather than relying on the encryption of WhatsApp and telegram.

How should a semester break be spent?
We asked Murat Aydın, an education expert and student coach, how students should spend the semester break.
The semester break should not only be thought of as a time for students to rest, have fun, spend time in front of the TV or computer.
The mid-term holiday is a very important opportunity to prepare for the new semester, and to review the past semester.
The vacation period, also called leisure time, is also an important opportunity for personal development, gaining knowledge and skills, and acquiring hobbies.
Make a semester evaluation list.
Write down and try to implement everything you do and plan.
Be sure that you will enjoy it and have a really productive semester.
Now, let's talk about how a productive semester should be for students who are now preparing for YGS-LYS.

Because the questions that we receive from the friends preparing for the YGS-LYS exams are mostly like this: "How should we evaluate this period? Should we solve lots of questions or solve our missing topics?"
Let us begin with some recommendations for students who are preparing for the exam so that they can answer these questions and also go through a productive period.

The preparation for the exam should normally start from 9th grade, but we try to complete this process in the last year. This necessitates us to spend the last year more efficiently and effectively and use our time more productively.
The last year student has to carry out both the exam preparation and the school written work at the same time.
Even if the graduate student has taken and experienced the exam (YGS-LYS) at least once, the year that he/she will prepare for the exam again is of crucial importance for the graduate student.
Because most students and their families tend to see that year as their last chance, it creates even more stress.

Studying for classes is something that students do in a reactive way, something they feel they have to do, something they don't enjoy, and something they'll always put off until the last minute, but for those students who are able to make it a regular habit, studying becomes a task that is always on the agenda, with a set time and place.
Now we have a mid-term holiday in front of us and we should make the best of it.
In order to do this, we must have a plan that lets us manage our time well.
Studying During the Mid-term Break:
Everyone should first make a plan that fits their own situation.
What has been done in the first period, what remains unfinished; you should plan the day, the week, and the 15-day time period.
During this period, there should be both topic reviews and question solutions.
At the same time, students who do not lack very much can solve 1-2 sample exams on average.
Fill in the Gaps: Studies show that people forget 75 percent of what they learn within a week, 66 percent within a day and 54 percent within an hour.
The best and most effective way to eliminate forgetting is through repetition.
Students who make many mistakes on past topics should give priority to general review of these topics.
First, determine your weak areas and plan day by day, assign a topic to each day and make sure to solve them.
This planning will calm you down both academically and psychologically.
When you place the topics into your plan, pay attention to the topics on which you make the most errors.
Because in the future, you will not have such a long vacation period.
Solve the following questions.
It is as important to solve questions as it is to revise the subject.
Because we can only see how well we understand the work we do through the feedback we get from the questions we solve.
Do not forget to set a certain number of problems to be solved per day.

The number of questions you will solve can vary depending on the amount of work you do that day; on a day when you work on a topic-based subject, you may not be able to solve many questions, but still, we should work on solving a certain amount of questions to see how much we have learned about that day's topic.
Take the Practice Tests:
Another work you should do during the half-year holidays is solving test exams.
Although not all of the topics are finished, at least you can solve the exams and the test questions.
Let's say you've tackled the Turkish lessons for the most part; you can solve the 40 question Turkish sample tests.
And make sure to time yourself when doing it.
If you can solve 40 Turkish questions in 60 minutes at first, your next goal should be to solve them in a few minutes less time if possible.
Holiday and Hobby Plan:
Of course, holiday does not only mean studying; you should also reserve a few days for your holiday, rest and hobbies.
A holiday period spent only studying will prevent you from recharging and resting.
For that reason, you should have some special time for yourself within your plans.
Reading books, watching television and surfing the internet can be among your plans, but what is most important is how much time you spend on each thing.
I also have a small piece of advice for friends who could not spend their first semester productively.
If you say that my first semester did not go very well, I could not work hard and I had too many deficiencies, then this semester break is a great opportunity for you too.
But firstly you have to make a decision and believe in it.
In the Turkish football super league in the 2009-2010 season, goals were scored mostly between the 76th and the 90th minutes.
Now answer the question you asked yourself. Is the match over and you are going to the locker room or is the match still going on and you have many minutes to score a goal?
I suppose no one wants to use the classic reply of a defeated football team's coach or players, "now we will look forward to the next match".
Now, the only thing you should do is to forget the past and look forward and run instead of walking.
To sum up what we have said:
First of all, make a semester break plan,
2) Review the topics you know.
3) Take care of your neglected matters.
4) Answer the questions to consolidate your knowledge of the topic.
Solve the practice tests.
Read a book,
Set new goals for the new period,
Make time for yourself, your hobbies, and the things you enjoy.
Make time for your family and friends,
Devote time to social and cultural activities (cinema, sports, theater, concert, excursion, picnic, etc.)
Kervan has set off for a long journey.

Şinasi Demirel, the founder of Kervan, which is one of the largest home store chains in Turkey with 45 stores averaging 1,000 square meters, and his son Hasan have added Home Sweet Home, which has 17 stores abroad and 25 stores in Turkey, to the Kervan group.
With the operation, whose trade registry procedures were recently completed, Kervan has become the owner of 17 Home Sweet Home stores abroad.
Şinasi Demirel, who stated that there are still no Kervan stores abroad, said, "Now we will continue big-scale store sales with Kervan and smaller-scale store sales with Home Sweet Home."
He said, "The caravan will also open up to foreign countries".
With the merger of Home Sweet Home, with a turnover of 50 million liras, and Kervan, with a turnover of 90 million liras, a retail chain emerged with a turnover of 140 million liras.
Kervan, which has 45 stores in 35 cities, has a total sales space of 45 thousand square meters.
25 of the stores are owned by the parent company.
There are about 500 people employed at Kervan.
Home Sweet Home has 25 stores in Turkey and 17 stores abroad and it has a total sales area of 6500 square meters and it has 320 employees.

Kadir Kalaycıoğlu, Chairman of the Board of Home Sweet Home, which produces, exports and retails with his partner Alev Pakten, said that they were very happy with the merger with Kervan, and he added, "We are from Mardin, and we entered this sector in 1998."
From the beginning, we would have created a brand with the support of Şinasi Beyler.
Şinasi Bey is the TRT of this sector.
We also learned a lot from him.
In fact, we took our first steps in the retail world by opening our first store in Ak Merkez.
We were already working with Kervan, not as competitors but as strategic partners.
He said that a very significant synergy will emerge with this merger.
Kalaycıoğlu said that Home Sweet Home currently has 17 stores abroad, mostly in the Middle East, and that they also started export to China last month.
Kalaycıoğlu said, "We also opened our first corner in Shanghai."
We have reached an agreement with a chain of 200 stores.
He said, "We will develop large-scale retailing outside the country under the name of Kervan and small-scale retailing under the name of Home Sweet Home."

The life story of Sabri Bey, the father of Ülker.

We divided the world into regions.

Jeff van der Eems will be responsible for England, Continental Europe, and Africa.
Ali Ülker, who I can describe as a quality and innovation guru, takes on global responsibility in his field, and Cem Karakaş will help me manage the project.

Subaru in Japan and Pervin in Iran.
We took inspiration from Pleiades, the Latin name for the star cluster consisting of seven stars, which means Ülker in Turkish and Süreyya in Arabic.
So, if fate wills, we translated Ülker to global.
Ali Ulker, Vice Chairman of the Board of Yildiz Holding, also stated that they have started to create synergy in innovation by cooperating with laboratories in different countries, and added:

The 21-item final statement, which was unanimously accepted at the CHP congress, requests the removal of the objections on the European Charter of Local Self-Government, which has been brought to the agenda with the autonomy discussions of the DTK, and an increase in the sharing of powers at the local level.
The declaration also included the goals of "ending the party state regime" and "establishing a transparent, accountable rule of law".

The part where Kılıçdaroğlu says that they will defend democracy to the death, whatever the cost was the most applauded part of the speech.
The CHP, which has held a total of 34 regular and 18 extraordinary congresses, convened its 53rd grand congress yesterday at Ankara Arena.
The turnout was high.
There were more than 15 thousand CHP members in the 12 thousand seat hall.
But there was no real sense of excitement among the crowd.
The most exciting moment was when Kılıçdaroğlu entered the hall together with his wife Selvi Kılıçdaroğlu.
The excitement continued as the Kılıçdaroğlu couple greeted the room.
There was not a trace of the discipline seen at AK Party congresses in the hall.
There was much activity in the field section of the Arena while Kılıçdaroğlu was speaking.
Obviously, the CHP members who wanted to get into the Party Assembly preferred to reach out and seek support by explaining themselves to party leaders and journalists.

A CHP executive tried to explain that it is not a bad thing by saying, "It is better than the party meetings in Korea or the Soviet Union where party members are lined up like strings and sit in silence".
There is another difference between the CHP congress and the AK Party or MHP congresses.
Only party leaders speak at these meetings.
In the CHP, the congress turns into a platform where the party problems are also discussed.
At yesterday's congress, since there were a lot of party members who wanted to speak, the Chair of the Presidential Council, Murat Karayalçın, had difficulty in setting the time limit.

While there were expressions of "The country is going wrong" on the faces and tongues, there was also a distance to the remarks of "You are going to change the course of things with the picture that will come out of this hall."
All CHP members said something should be done, but there was no consistent and strong answer to the question of what should be done.
The fact that there will be no elections in the next four years has a big impact on that.
When Kılıçdaroğlu went to the podium, we journalists waited to see what answer he would give to the question "What should we do?"
Kılıçdaroğlu first answered the question "What is going on?"
He highlighted the issue of the jailed journalists, the pressure on the academics for the declaration, the incidents in the southeast, and the deadlock in foreign policy.
He gave a long response to "Anatolian myths" about CHP, such as "it is an irreligious party", "it supports coups", "it is a party of elitists".
When it came to the "what to do" stage, he attempted to come up with a "strategy" rather than talk about concrete steps.
He emphasized that all these problems could be overcome with a stronger democracy and more justice.
He also made a promise on behalf of the CHP and said, "Regardless of the cost, we will work until we bring democracy."
"We will fight to the death for democracy," he said.
One last note; we should also remember that the CHP has solved its "organization" problem by its 53rd congress, and now it can hold congresses without problems.
Meanwhile, press cards had been printed for the 900 journalists said to be following the congress, although the turnout of journalists in the hall was not at that level.
The Ankara representatives of the media organizations were not as eager to follow the congress as they were at AK Party congresses.

iOS9: how to get the new iPhone operating system, Apple update released
You can go to the Settings app for the new operating system and tap "General" and then select "Software Update."
When it is ready, your phone will offer you the option to download and install it.
Some users experienced a problem after this installation and received an error message saying "Software update failed".
To solve this problem, it is suggested that users wait for a decrease in the loading on the system, or try iTunes and try to upgrade from there.
The phone system will guide you through the rest of the process.

This could mean deleting apps to make room - but Apple has prevented this by shrinking the update and offering to delete some apps, then using a special tool to reinstall them when the process is complete.
While the update is in progress it is worth making sure that your phone is charged or that you have a charging device nearby to avoid your battery running out.
If the battery is too low, Apple won't allow the update, since the phone might stop midway through the update.

FedEx's revenues are mixed and financial outlook for 2016 is down

FedEx reported disappointing results for the past three months, and the cargo giant lowered its profit forecast for the full year, citing a decline in demand for shipping services and higher costs in ground services.
The company also said it plans to hire around 55,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.
Last year at this time, FedEx announced it would hire 50,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.
The pre-open trading, which began 45 minutes before the opening gong on Wednesday, fell by approximately 2.5%.
FedEx Corp said it expects earnings in its fiscal year ending next May to be between $10.40 and $10.90, which is 20 cents lower than its previous forecast.
Analysts were expecting $10.84 based on a survey conducted by FactSet.
Despite an average 4.9% increase that will take effect on January 4th and higher surcharges on heavy or large packages that will start in November, there is a possibility of a decrease.
According to the company, cost cuts, higher revenue and the growth of e-commerce are expected to result in higher profits than the previous year.
Chairman and CEO Fred Smith said the company "delivered solid performance despite the weak economic conditions, particularly in manufacturing and global trade."
The holiday hiring plans were announced one day after rival UPS said it planned to hire between 90,000 and 95,000 extra workers, the same number as last year.
In the three-month period ending on August 31, FedEx increased its revenue by 6% to $692 million compared to the previous year.
The earnings per share came in at $2.42, which was below the $2.44 predicted by 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research.
Income increased by 5 percent to 12.3 billion dollars.
Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $12.23 billion.
FedEx took a hit from a decline in international priority shipping last year, which led to a slowdown in revenue in its Express unit.
But the explosion in online shopping boosted FedEx Ground results.
In the last quarter, revenue from land services increased by 29 percent, but operating revenue remained basically stagnant due to high costs in major packages and internal insurance.
While there was a decline in revenues in the cargo business due to the high labour costs, the express unit saw high revenues due to high base rates.
In pre-market trading, about an hour before the opening bell, FedEx shares fell $3.85 or 2.5% to $150.15.
They closed on Tuesday down 11 percent for the year and 17 percent below the record set on June 11.

In one of the most widely anticipated meetings in years, Federal Reserve policymakers spent two days this week around a 27-foot Honduran mahogany table debating whether it's finally time to raise interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade.
A two-storey meeting room on one side of the central bank will feature a mural of the United States.
It is a reminder that the Fed Chairman Janet L. Yellen and her colleagues put the nation's economic interest above all else.
The Federal Reserve has two mandates from congress: to maximize employment in the United States and to keep prices stable.
But since the Great Depression, Fed leaders have accepted a third unwritten mandate: financial stability.

And this third mandate may be the X factor in the highly anticipated decision, to be announced Thursday, on whether the US economy is ready to start cutting back on the unprecedented stimulative support of near-zero short-term interest rates that has been in place since late 2008.

While most data show the data economy growing strongly, the latest turmoil in global financial markets could make already cautious fed officials shy away from adding fragility by raising the benchmark federal fund rate - by even a quarter of a percentage point.
"Quite frankly, it will be the labor market and the inflation that they watch first and foremost," said Lindsey M. Piegza, chief economist at brokerage firm Stifel Nicolaus & Co.
“But if they are looking for an excuse not to raise the rate, the increasing uncertainty surrounding the global economy should give them ample reason to wait for a bit longer," he said.
There is no consensus on what the Fed will do, and this is causing turmoil in the financial markets themselves.
Half of the economists surveyed by Bloomberg recently expected a rate increase this week.
Meanwhile, financial markets are expecting the Fed to keep waiting with its main indicator showing only a roughly 30% chance of an increase.
This situation could indicate a downturn in the stock market, unless policymakers blunt the impact by promising another increase if the Fed raises the rate.
On Tuesday, the Dow Jones industrial average rose 228.89 points or 1.4% to 16,599.85.
John Lonski, chief economist at Moody's Capital Markets Research Group, said the increase was triggered by expectations that Fed policy makers will hold the rate steady this week.
"It would be surprising if the Fed raised rates at the moment," he said.
If the Fed officials had made such a decision, they would have had to take a long year to calm the financial markets so as not to cause panic.
Other experts have argued that a rate increase could calm financial markets by lifting the fog of uncertainty about when the Fed will act.

Only a month ago, the Fed seemed to be on track to raise rates by a quarter point this month, a small step toward gradually tightening monetary conditions that would further strengthen the U.S. recovery.
Yellen, despite complaints from liberals about the need for a more economic process, said she expects the rate increase this year during the spring months and at the beginning of summer.
Although the rate of job creation slowed down in August, growth in the labor market was steady this year.
The unemployment rate fell to 5.1% last month, its lowest level in seven years and close to the rate the Fed considers full employment.
Salary increases showed signs of improvement.
And while inflation remains well below the central bank's 2% annual target, Fed policymakers said the sharp drop in oil prices was a significant factor.
Ian Shepherdson, chief economist at Pantheon Macroeconomics, said the economy could cope with higher rates and needed to do so despite the tightness of the labour market.
The financial markets around the world, however, were shaken when China's currency underwent a devaluation at the end of last month.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell more than 16 percent below its May record level, as investors feared that a slowing Chinese economy would drag down global growth.
The market bounced back, somehow, as the Dow was down nearly 10 percent from its high in May.
For Fed policy makers, market turmoil makes it even more difficult to calculate when to raise interest rates.

Stephen D. Oliner, a senior research fellow at the UCLA Ziman Center for Real Estate and a former Fed official, says "Conditions could have tightened a bit with the uncertainty of what's going on in China's financial markets and a lack of news about slack in the economy over the past few weeks."
They now estimate that they will have to wait at least another month to better manage these effects.
"There is considerable uncertainty about the effects on the U.S. economy and almost no data to tie the developments in China to a later date," Oliner said.
The health of the global economy is not one of the Fed's primary concerns, so it should not be a factor in the technical decision-making.
But in reality, the Fed has become the world's monetary authority.
The impact of the central bank has been very big in the recent years.
Until then, the only clue from President Ben S. Bernanke was that the Fed could "moderate" its monetary expansion triggered by global market turmoil in 2013.

In a world where markets and economies are increasingly intertwined, Fed officials can be expected not only to monitor developments elsewhere, but also to consult with other central bankers and experts to better understand the global economy.
Zachary Karabell, the chief global strategist for wealth management firm Envestnet Inc., said the decision-making process is "more of an art than science."

Jeffrey Lacker, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, Va., noted this month that the Fed has "overreacted in the past to financial market movements that were not obviously related to economic fundamentals."
Lacker, who is a voting member of the policy-making Federal Open Market Committee, and who has been pushing for a rate increase, cited the 1998-99 decisions as an example.
Lacker says, "Despite limited advice on U.S. growth, the Asian financial crisis led the Fed to cut rates by three-quarters of a percentage point at three meetings."
A year later, Fed officials reversed the cuts.
Adam S. Posen, a former member of the Bank of England’s rate-setting committee, said the Fed should focus on financial stability only during major crises, such as the 2008 market meltdown.
He said that the recent upheaval hadn't reached this level.
You really don't want to be in a situation where you have to raise rates because the markets are unhappy, said Posen, head of the Peterson Institute for International Economics.
The Central Bank Law still has two authorities and does not mention financial balance, and I don't think that until this changes, they should take action in that direction.
Do you want a great Thai market?
Try LAX-C in China Town.
Yes, the Chinese neighborhood.
The market/warehouse was opened in 1997 and belongs to LAX-C Inc.
LAX-C is a Thai wholesale market that also sells to the public, often referred to as Thai Costco.
Yes, that is China Town, not Taiwan Town.
The market/warehouse is a one-stop shop carrying a wide range of fresh, frozen and dried foods, popular Asian and Thai snacks, kitchenware, furniture, religious and holiday decorations.
If you want to buy engine oil, there is also an automotive section.
The store is huge and it can take an hour to walk through all of the corridors.
If you get hungry during all of this shopping, grab some food from LAX-C BBQ Express.
The inside eating area (nice, cheap) is next to the checkout counters, and various take-out options are available.
What's in stock: Do you want something from Thailand?
He is probably in LAX-C.
The products are reasonably priced and some of them are sold in bulk.
Among the fresh products there are special Asian and regional Thai spices, fruits and more.
The meat counter is extensive, and so is the fish - the staff behind the counter will clean and fillet the fish, and they will even fry it for you if you want.

There is a large frozen section in the store; you can find frozen curry leaves, bitter melons, and galangal, whole ducks, fish, beef blood, fish balls, regional sausages, commercial food items, and much more.
Who shops here: restaurant owners and chefs, families and individuals.
Both shopping carts and forklifts are available in the wide corridors.
Fresh monthong durian is located just next to the exit stand.
Where: Between Chinatown and Downtown, in the industrial section of Los Angeles, a few blocks from Philippe The Original.
Parking: LAX-C has its own parking lot, which it shares with other stores and restaurants.
Even though the store is very busy, finding a parking spot is usually not difficult.
Brazil's Rio Grande Pediatrics Society promotes healthy nutrition during the breastfeeding period.

The Brazilian pediatrics organization SPRS has resorted to a shocking method by including milk baby pictures painted with unhealthy food depictions to try to get attention and inform mothers about the importance of healthy nutrition during breastfeeding.
Human milk is made up of many types of proteins, fats, vitamins and carbohydrates that provide all the necessary nutrients for babies to develop a healthy immune system.
Pregnant women and new mothers are advised to raise their daily calorie intake by about 500 calories to compensate for extra energy requirements.
However, according to new research, the food supplement mothers should take is not limited to caloric intake.

According to a new study conducted by Professor Robert Waterland of Baylor College of Medicine, healthy nutrition of pregnant women has affected the genetic expression of their babies and protected them from tumor development.
Unfortunately, it has been found that an unhealthy diet negatively affects the child's immune system.

The final three think Sam Wood is the perfect man, but who will he choose?
Has the secret been revealed? ...
Lana Jeavons-Fellows, Sarah Mackay and Snezana Markoski may have inadvertently revealed who will win The Bachelor.
The woman Sam Wood would choose at the end of the Bachelor program was kept a big secret.
And the remaining three girls are doing their best not to reveal who got the last rose.
But if we check in with Lana Jeavons-Fellows, Sarah Mackay and Snezana Markoski before the three are cut down to two, they might inadvertently give us a clue as to who will be the winner.
Sam Wood sealed his lips until the final on Thursday.
All three women described why Wood was perfect in a lyrical way; they emphasized why they wanted to be his partner by focusing on his humor, ambition, family values, and positive attitude.
But the answers they give to the question "If it's not you, who should get the last rose?" might contain some information about who will win The Bachelor's heart.
Both Jeavons-Fellows and Markoski quickly identified Mackay as the best candidate other than themselves.
Sarah Mackay and Sam Wood have been quite close since the first day.
Jeavons-Fellows said, "From the moment they walked in the door, I felt they were right for each other and I continued to feel that way throughout the programme."
Markoski adds, “Sarah is very practical and it is very fun to be around her.”
I saw them together and there is chemistry between them.
They feel very good and comfortable when next to each other.
Sarah Mackay thinks that she and Sam Wood will get along very well.
Mackay said last week's home visits convinced him that Wood was the "right guy."
"I realised that this was definitely not just a game when I saw it with my friends and family - I'm now completely hooked," he said.
When he was asked who he would choose if he could not have Wood, he was mysterious.
"I don't know if I can say that" he said.
"I love the other girls equally – Snezana and Lana are equals."
The Bachelor is broadcast on Channel 10 on Wednesday at 19:30.

Jarryd Hayne had various options as to where he would start his NFL career.
Detroit and Seattle showed a lot of interest to him after he moved to the US, and many other teams approached him after his impressive open training day last year.
However, Hayne chose the San Francisco 49ers and coach Jim Tomsula, and it looks like a very wise decision.
Some coaches benched Hayne because of his poor performance in the Australian rugby league, as he was benched in the 20-3 loss to Minnesota on Tuesday.
But Tomsula believed in him and gave Hayne another chance by including him in a game after Reggie Bush's injury.
After the game, Tomsula continued to show his true colors in the locker room.
Instead of humiliating the rookies in front of the whole team, he encouraged them.
Tomsula also publicly supported Hayne during the post-match press conference.
49ers reporter Cam Inman said Hayne also got some encouragement from special teams coordinator Thomas McGaughey, who told him to forget about the mishap and get on with the next play.
Jarryd Hayne caused Minnesota Vikings to score in the first quarter and fumbled the ball.
This was not what Hayne and his large Australian fan base had envisioned for his first NFL game.
Hayne was seen swearing as he left the field after dropping the ball, and later told Australian radio duo Hamish and Andy on 2DayFM 104.1 he could not have had a worse start to his NFL career.
Hayne said, "It was just one of those things, you get upset and move on to the next game and that's it."
Hayne reminded the game of the pass that made the score for Queensland in the first game of Origin in 2007.
Still, it was a great experience for the 27-year-old performer.
Hayne posted a photo on Instagram of him holding an Australian flag with the fans after the game.

Four people were killed in Nepal as police shot plastic bullets at demonstrators.
Four people, including a 4-year-old boy, were killed when police opened fire on a crowd protesting against a proposed new constitution in the country, an official said Wednesday.
The incident took place on Tuesday evening in the city of Rupandehi, 175 miles west of the capital, Katmandu.
District chief Bishnu Prasad Dhakal said more than 1,000 protesters had gathered outside a police station and some had thrown stones and fire bombs.
Mr Dhakal said police had used tear gas and opened fire into the air before using the plastic bullets.
He said that 20 police officers and five civilians were injured.
It is not clear why the use of plastic bullets, which are known to kill but are generally used as a less lethal alternative, should result in such a high fatality rate.

The conflict is the latest in a series of violent protests that have swept the southern plains of Nepal for weeks, where members of the Madhesi ethnic group say the regions created by the proposed constitution will dilute their political influence.
The ethnic Tharus group, who also want to establish their own state, are holding protest demonstrations in western Nepal.
At least 40 people, including 11 police officers, have died in the violent clashes that have been ongoing since August 10.

On that date, the four main political parties had agreed to divide the country into regions - an important, but potentially divisive step in drafting a new constitution for Nepal, which for centuries has been governed by a central government.
Work on a new constitution had been under way since 2008, but lawmakers accelerated the process following the devastating earthquake in April that killed thousands of people.
Lawmakers worked on the draft of the constitutional provisions this week in Katmandu, and officials said the new text will be ready by Sunday.
The NHC said there is a 60% chance of a hurricane forming in the south of the Cape Verde Islands

The US National Hurricane Center said on Tuesday that there was a 60 percent chance that a large low pressure system located about 350 miles (560 km) south of the Southern Cape Verde Islands would develop into a tropical storm within the next 48 hours.

Another well-defined low pressure system was seen between the Cape Verde Islands and the Lesser Antilles and the Miami-based National Hurricane Center said there is a 60 percent chance it will develop into a tropical storm within the next two days.
Google started a matching donation campaign to raise 11 million dollars for refugees.

Google Inc (GOOGL.O) announced a donation-matching campaign aimed at raising $11 million for humanitarian organizations helping thousands of refugees who have fled war-torn and impoverished countries to Europe.
Google announced its donation initiative with an unexpected personal approach on its blog.
Instead of a manager making this statement, Rita Masoud, a Google employee who had escaped Kabul with her family at the age of seven, wrote about her own personal experience.
"In addition to hunger, thirst, cold, and fear, there were many dark bus and train journeys during our journey", he wrote.
I was lucky.
But as the refugee and migrant crisis in Europe has grown, many families like mine are in need of help.

The donations will go to four non-profit organizations that help refugees and migrants: Doctors Without Borders, the International Rescue Committee, Save the Children and the UN High Commissioner for Refugees.
Google said it will match the first $5.5 million in donations at google.com/refugeerelief until it raises $11 million.

Europe is facing the worst refugee crisis since the Second World War, and the main reason for this is the civil war in Syria, which has lasted for four years and has displaced more than four million people this year.
Many refugees are fleeing from Afghanistan, Yemen, Iraq, and Libya, which have been damaged by many wars.
By Yasmeen Abutaleb, Edited by Christian Plumb
Weight loss surgery may help diabetes patients who are moderately obese
According to a new study, the benefits of obesity surgery in patients with type 2 diabetes and moderate obesity can take at least five years to appear.
However, it is still too early to say whether moderately obese diabetics who have undergone obesity surgery live longer than those who have not had any surgical intervention.
According to Dr. Robin Blackstone, who has authored a new study on JAMA surgery and is an expert on obesity surgery, "it takes a long time for death rates to emerge."
Weight loss surgery, also known as bariatric surgery, uses various methods to reduce the size of the stomach.
These decrease hunger and limit the body's ability to digest food.

Over the years, bariatric surgery has been shown to be effective in treating type 2 diabetes, but most of the research has been done on people who are severely obese with a body mass index (BMI) of 35 or higher.
BMI, which is measured according to the ratio of height and weight, is considered normal between 18.5 and 24.9.
A BMI of 25 or over indicates that a person is overweight, and a BMI of over 30 indicates that a person is obese.
You can calculate your BMI from the following link: 1.usa.gov/1D0ZqDv.

In the new research, researchers at Taiwan's fully-equipped Min-Sheng Hospital used data from a trial in which they compared two types of bariatric surgery - gastric bypass and sleeve gastrectomy - used to treat moderately obese individuals with type 2 diabetes since 2007.
By the end of the study's fifth year, the average BMI of those who had the operation had dropped from 31 to 24.5.
By contrast, the BMI of those receiving non-surgical diabetes treatment remained stable around 29.
Diabetes was completely resolved in 36% of those who underwent surgery and was partially resolved in 28%.
In the group that was treated medically, diabetes was completely resolved in only 1% and partially resolved in only 2%.
Also, blood pressure control, triglycerides, and "bad" LDL cholesterol were generally better in the surgical treatment group, the authors noted.
The researchers also have looked at levels of A1c hemoglobin, which reflects blood sugar levels in patients over time.
According to the researchers, it is best to keep A1c hemoglobin below 7%.
After the surgery, the A1C hemoglobin average dropped from about 9 percent to about 6 percent.
In the group that received medical treatment, the rate remained around 8%.
However, better glycemic control with improved A1c levels over these five years did not reduce mortality rates, according to Dr. Chih-Cheng Hsu and colleagues, who led the study.
The research team compared the findings with these two types of surgery.

In the fifth year, the bypass surgery group lost more weight (18.7 to 14.2 kg) than the gastric bypass surgery group, and a higher decline was observed in BMI (7.4 to 5.1) and hemoglobin A1c (3.1 to 2.1); in addition, the likelihood of diabetes to completely decrease was higher (46.9 to 16.7).

Although the study did not show a clear benefit for survival at the end of the fifth year after surgery, Dr. Blackstone from the Arizona College of Medicine-Phoenix said there were valid data that surgery extended life span according to a study conducted among heavier patients in Sweden.

In this study, Swedish researchers found that the risk of death over the course of 15 years for obese patients who had undergone bariatric surgery was 29 percent lower than for another group who had received more conventional treatment.

Although this latest study did not show what the benefits of surgery are for these patients in terms of their survival, according to Blackstone, it is reassuring for people who are related to this issue and have a BMI of less than 35.
The most important part of the article is this, because it says that the surgery is safe in the group with low BMI, and there was no increase in the risk of death or renal disease, he said.
Blackstone added that people and doctors should take the weight gain issue seriously when a patient's BMI drops below 27 to 30.
I think we have waited long enough for people to take this seriously, he said.
I think it is really hard to reverse the genetic changes that make their bodies prone to obesity and diabetes after they have collected these genetic changes in their bodies.
"It is impossible for everybody to come to Europe" - Dalai Lama - RT News
The Dalai Lama said that Europe cannot host all refugees, and added that the real solution to the current refugee crisis lies in the Middle East.
The Tibetan Buddhist leader called for an end to the violence in their home countries.
The Dalai Lama mentioned the ongoing refugee crisis during his speech at the opening of the Dalai Lama Centre for Compassion at Oxford, which is the beginning of his 10-day visit to England.
He claimed that, under the current circumstances, humanity's interests should be given precedence over the interests of countries or continents.
At the same time, he also stressed that Western European countries' responses to the refugee crisis, although appreciated, were inadequate from this point of view.
In his speech, he said "It is impossible for everyone to come to Europe."
Although he commends the efforts of Germany and Austria to deal with the crisis, the Dalai Lama says they are only temporary solutions.

"It is wonderful to deal with a few thousand refugees, but at the same time you have to think about long-term solutions; you have to think about how you can bring about durable peace and durable development to Muslim countries, essentially through education," he emphasized.
We need to think about how to reduce the number of deaths in our country.
We need to reduce the use of power.
“The use of force has never solved any problem,” he added.

When addressing the issue of violence, the Dalai Lama also referred to what George Bush did after the 9/11 attacks and stated that the violent response of the U.S. started a chain of uncontrollable events.
In a letter I wrote to President Bush after September 11th, I conveyed my condolences and indicated that the solution to the problem should not involve any violent methods.
"I know their motivation is good, but they use force and it brings unexpected consequences," the Dalai Lama said.
There has been a four-fold increase in children ingesting hand sanitizers in the last four years.
Poison control centers in the United States have reported a nearly 400 percent rise in the rate of alcohol-containing hand sanitizer ingestions in children under 12 since 2010.

According to Dr. Gaylord Lopez, the director of the Georgia Poison Center, the number of reported cases of children aged under 12 swallowing hand sanitizers has increased from 3,266 in 2010 to 16,117 in 2014.
Lopez told CNN that "kids are more attracted to these types of products and unfortunately there are a percentage of them that need to be removed."
Some children drink hand sanitizers on purpose and some say that they do it to impress their friends or as a social media challenge.
Videos on YouTube show teenagers drinking antiseptic for cheap drunkenness.
It has been reported that some teenagers mix the antiseptic solution with mouthwashes containing alcohol to create a more potent drink.
Young children can be attracted to the appealing smell of antiseptics.
Lopez said, "The child doesn't think it is a bad thing."
Most of the ones that look more appealing are the scented ones.
There are hand sanitizers available in strawberry, grape and orange scents, which are extremely attractive to children.
Hand sanitizers contain between 45 to 95 percent alcohol, depending on how you look at it.
Especially in small children, a few sips of alcohol can cause alcohol poisoning.
According to a statement given by Dr. Stephen Thornton, the head of the Poison Control Center at the University of Kansas Hospital, to Fox 4 TV in Kansas City, it is "high-concentrated alcohol."
You wouldn't leave a few whisky glasses lying around, but people just leave these hand sanitizers lying around and it's a very easy way for children to consume a lot of alcohol.
Recently, six-year-old Nhaijah Russell was taken to the hospital for treatment after swallowing only four squirts of strawberry-scented hand sanitizer at her school.

According to Dr. Chris Ritchey, the emergency room doctor who treated him at the Gwinnett Medical Center outside Atlanta, his blood alcohol content was 0.179, which is twice the legal limit for an adult.
Nhaijah was unable to pronounce words and was not able to walk when he arrived at the emergency room.

According to Rithey, the doctors kept the girl overnight under observation in a separate children's hospital because alcohol caused the child to fall and hit her head, even though there was no sign of brain trauma.
In a statement to CNN, Anne Ortoria Scott said it was “very scary”.
It could have been fatal for my child.
Lopez advised parents and teachers to use alcohol-free products or keep contact with skin to a minimum and place antiseptic wipes in places where children cannot reach.
Apart from alcohol poisoning, some antiseptics have been associated with death cases.
In 2013, two women in Ontario died after ingesting a hand sanitizer containing an unnamed toxic substance.
Health officials had suggested that the substance could be methyl alcohol, not ethyl alcohol as stated on the ingredients list, which has lethal effects.
In January, three fourth-grade students in upstate New York, according to police reports, conspired to poison "bad" teachers by placing antibacterial products around the classroom.
The teacher has forbidden the use of hand sanitizer in the classroom because he is highly allergic to it.
The police labeled this thwarted plan as a "futile attempt" and recommended a disciplinary punishment for the school administration.

Van Persie, who is a fan of Udoh, had a warm chat with Udoh and said, "I came to watch you."
You will watch one of my training sessions with your friends.

Traitors had nowhere to hide and they sought refuge in the white cloth.
PKK terrorists, who were cornered in the streets, found the solution of running away by mixing in with the citizens and carrying white flags.
Security forces are applying the GBT method to prevent the infiltration.

With the peace and democracy operations that started on July 23, the organization was dealt a massive blow in rural and border areas, making it unable to take action, and the activist power of the organization in the districts was also broken.

According to information gathered from sources in the region, the organization, which suffered a serious blow in Silopi, has been rendered ineffective through the seizure of their weapons and ammunition depots.
Some citizens who fled the attacks of the terrorist organization PKK are leaving the conflict areas with white flags in their hands under the control of the police and the military.
The terrorists, who were stuck in the narrow alleys and did not have any escape point, also mixed with the citizens and started to escape waving a white flag.
The security forces carry out a General Information Collection (GIC) search concerning the individuals they suspect.

In Silopi, a PKK terrorist is reported to have infiltrated the population with a white flag, but when he realized that he would be caught during GBT questioning, he attempted to run away and was neutralized.
COMMANDOS WILL PREVENT CLOGGING
In Cizre, which is one of the closely watched districts in the region, the army and police have dealt a big blow to the terrorist organisation.
It is reported that the neighborhood of Yafes, where the militants were holed up, has been largely cleaned up.
The joint teams, made up of police and gendarmerie special operations units, completed their tasks and handed over their positions to the commandos.
The commandos who settled in the Yafes neighborhood are also taking precautions to prevent terrorists from infiltrating again.
It was also indicated that in other districts security in the areas cleansed of terrorists by joint units will be left to the police teams.
One ton of baklava for the police and the military
The Kilis Municipality sent a ton of baklava to the special operation police and soldiers who served in Cizre, Sur and Silopi under difficult conditions.
Mayor Hasan Kara stated that they condemn terror and said, "May God give power and strength to our security forces who protect our country and nation under difficult conditions."
"We wish God's mercy on our martyrs and quick healing for our veterans" he said.
The people of Çınarlı recounted the night of terror
The people of Çınar reacted very strongly to the attack.
A large proportion of the houses around the barracks where the explosion took place were rendered uninhabitable.
Emin Altunç, a resident of the neighborhood, said, "My son was wounded but we couldn't get out of the house because of the gunfire."
"We were able to take our son to the hospital in an hour," he said.
Sabiha Ozcan, who says her husband was wounded in the explosion, explains, "My husband was sleeping in the room at the time of the explosion, and he was injured."
He was dragged up to the door.
He was covered in blood.
"I condemn these events," he said.
14 people lost their lives on the ski slope.
A bus carrying skiers in Karuizawa, one of Japan's ski resorts, lost control and overturned.
It was reported that 14 people died in the accident, while 27 people were injured.
The officials reported that the bus fell from a height of around 3 meters and crashed into the barrier.
It was reported that there was no ice on the road and an investigation has been launched into the accident.
He tore up a 50 kilometer long concrete road and sold it!
Aleksander Protopopov, the director of a prison in Russia's Komi region, was arrested on charges of selling a 50-km long concrete road built on the highway.
It was reported that Protopopov earned 80 thousand dollars (243 thousand TL) by using his position to remove and sell a portion of the concrete laid on the highway, between 2010 and 2015.
7,750 euros for 15 million lira
Viola Colombo, a woman living in Venice, Italy, won the right to convert 15 million lire she found in an old trunk she bought on the internet auction site e-Bay into euros.
Colombo's request to exchange the old Italian lire, which he bought a few euros for in 2014, was rejected by the Central Bank.
The court found that Colombo was entitled to receive 7,750 euros (about 26,000 TL).
UNESCO application for the island that women are not allowed to enter
Japan has applied to have Okunoshima Island, which only allows males to set foot on its grounds due to the temples, included on UNESCO's World Heritage Sites list in 2017.
But the clergy class on the island opposes this decision out of the fear that 'tourists will come'.
Saudi Arabia did not give up on TÜBİTAK

Science, Industry and Technology Minister Fikri Işık stated that a new agreement has been made on the second party sale of the Ballistic Image Analysis and Identification System (BALISTIKA) developed by the Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TÜBİTAK), and said, "With the agreement that includes the development and installation of 8 additional systems, the number of BALISTIKA systems that will be serving in Saudi Arabia will increase from 6 to 14".
Işık made statements about BALİSTİKA, which was developed by the TÜBİTAK Space Technologies Research Institute.

Işık said that the system enables the ballistic analysis of the guns, bullet cores and casings seized in the incidents to be compared against the data in the central database, thus eliminating the problems that ballistic experts encounter when they analyze casings and bullet cores.
Light said that the data obtained from different geographic locations, and the accompanying information, could be stored and queried together thanks to BALLISTICS.

Işık points out that one of the most important properties of the system is its ability to obtain and show three-dimensional data with more details and fewer errors, and says that thanks to the innovations brought by the system, decisions made by the ballistics expert can be made more quickly and the success rate increases greatly.
BALISTICA was exported within the scope of the SUBA-1 project

Işık emphasized that BALISTIKA meets all the criteria of success measurements and received a full mark from the General Directorate of Security and stated that the system, which was established in ten different areas, starting with Ankara, covers all of Turkey.

Noting that the system has been exported abroad due to its success, Işık recalled that BALİSTİKA had been exported as part of the SUBA-1 Project, which was carried out with Saudi Arabia and the installation of it in 6 regions was successfully completed in 2013.

Işık says that a new agreement was concluded for the second sale of BALİSTİKA to Saudia Arabia, which is a continuation of the SUBA-1, and says that with the agreement that covers the development and installation of 8 additional systems, the number of BALİSTİKAs to be used in Saudi Arabia will increase from 6 to 14.
A crocodile fossil the size of a bus was found.
It was reported that the length of the prehistoric marine reptile was 10 meters and its weight was 3 tons.
The length of the crocodile's skull alone was measured to be 1.6 meters.
The researchers named the species Machimosaurus rex and published their findings in the journal Cretaceous Research.
The lead author of the paper, Federico Fanti of the University of Bologna, said the fossil, believed to be 130 million years old, was "nearly the size of a bus."
Fanti told the Washington Post that the enormous saltwater crocodile was "at least at the top of the food chain in a certain area at that time."
Paleontologists have revealed that M. rex, believed to be the largest crocodile that ever lived in the sea, used to ambush its prey in lagoons.

It is believed that the biggest freshwater crocodile in history was the Sarcosuchus imperator, which lived in Africa and South America 110 million years ago and could reach 12 meters in length and eight tons in weight.
They are all very confused!
The first book of the author Ece Temelkuran, 'All Women's Heads are Confused', which was published in 1996, has been adapted for the theater by the Aysa Production Theater under the same name.
The play, which stars Deniz Çakır, Zeynep Kankonde, İpek Türktan Kaynak, Kadir Çermik, and Şebnem Sönmez, is directed by Selen Uçer.
This play, where Uçer, who continues to write and direct the plays 'Poz' and 'Kuru Sıkı', has his first experience in writing the text and directing, questions the confusion in women's minds.
The play met its audience last week at Trump Show Center.
The game starts with a radio play.
In the dark, a voice takes us back to the past years...
Then the curtain opens.
A woman is standing at the edge of the window, about to jump down.
It becomes clear who the man is and why he has tried to commit suicide after the intervention of his neighbors.
LEAVING A LETTER
The character Ebru Uysal, played by Deniz Cakir, is a popular writer.
She was abandoned by her husband, but that is not the only reason.
There are things accumulated inside him since his childhood.
His inability to experience his father's love, his exclusion in his student years, his lonely childhood, his wrong relationships and his feeling of not being understood has brought him to this point.
He decides to commit suicide by jumping out of the window, but he is unable to do so.

Because the talkative and naive cleaning lady 'Aysel' (Zeynep Kankonde) lives in the next apartment and she starts to talk to the mysterious woman 'Perran' (Şebnem Sönmez) who lives in the opposite apartment.
They approach the situation as if it were a normal, ordinary process.
The woman gets even more tense and is unable to concentrate and jump.
When the famous singer Meltem Kaya (İpek Türktan Kaynak), who cleans their house, joins the conversation between the three, the situation gets worse.
Meltem, who approaches the situation with her own naive and sincere style, cannot stop herself from singing when she sees the crowd below.
This curious attempt at suicide takes a different dimension when the real estate agent Murat (Kadir Çermik) enters the house with a spare key.
The singer Meltem's giving false information to the press is making matters worse.
In the game, Nazan Öncel's song 'Sokak Kızı' is also used.
THE COMEDY OF MISERY
Ucer, who is directing for the first time, succeeds in preserving the pace and flow of the play.
Zeynep Kankonde and İpek Türktan Kaynak carry the comedic weight of the play.
The caricatured characters portrayed by the duo make the audience laugh, both with their facial expressions and their lines.
Şebnem Sönmez transmits her years of experience on the stage very well, and Deniz Çakır offers a convincing performance in portraying Ebru Uysal's depressive mental state.
Kadir Cermik, who makes a name for himself with his performance in the award-winning film 'Ivy', also accompanies these four women in a successful way.
Described as a comedy of crisis, this one-act play promises to make you laugh without thinking too hard.
Most of the beautiful lines coming out of Perran's mouth, played by Şebnem Sönmez, are as follows: Those who write with a ballpoint pen, read; those who live with a ballpoint pen, see.
All children have at least once thought about dying to punish their parents and for some reason, they always end up crying in the end.
The woman is left hanging in the air like an uninterpreted joke.
A woman looks for a funny story in which she always forgets the most important part.
Actually, every story begins with a kind of abandonment.
I sometimes have to put my hands in my pockets; I cannot stand things without pockets.
A person is confused about where to put their hands.
The more we are surprised, the more our hands increase.
People talk behind people's backs and make things up.
A misunderstanding becomes real.
All women's minds are confused because they are confused.
If you cannot succeed at dying, you have a chance to live.
'Consume kefir and live long.'
It is safe to consume at any age.

Pınar Kural Enç, a specialist dietician, points out that kefir, with milk as its main ingredient and which is more beneficial than milk, is one of the foods which can be consumed safely by people of all ages, "It is more nutritious than yogurt, because it contains protein, basic minerals and B vitamins."
It is also rich in B1, B12 and K vitamins.
It forms the basis of a healthy nervous system thanks to its calcium and magnesium content.
At the same time, it is a good source of phosphorus.
Kefir, which is also a filling food, does not cause weight gain.
"It is a drink that has a high nutritional value and is easy to digest," he said.
A cure for every disease

Pınar Kural Enç, the dietician, says that children, old people, pregnant women, and women going through menopause can consume kefir without hesitation, and "Kefir is a regional drink made in the Caucasus."
But now he has begun to make his name known to the world.
The secret of youth, kefir, which is an elixir of long and healthy life, is almost a cure for every ailment.
Kefir is one of the most natural ways of keeping babies away from metabolic diseases.
A friend of the intestines
This unique drink, that has many benefits, is a friend to the intestines.
There are 1.5 to 2 kilograms of bacteria and fungi in our intestines.
The microorganisms in the digestive system can also be divided into two groups: beneficial and harmful.
Beneficial microorganisms are called 'probiotic microorganisms'.

The activities of probiotics have as much effect as our liver, and if they are consumed in sufficient amounts, they prevent the harmful microorganisms in the intestines from adhering and spreading to the intestinal wall.
An imbalance in the healthy microorganisms in the intestines can lead to many diseases.
The health of the digestive tract should be maintained with the correct diet.
In order to do this, we must definitely consume probiotics in sufficient quantities.
It eliminates these problems in the intestines.
Kefir is a food that contains the most effective probiotic bacteria and the beneficial bacteria in it have a huge effect on strengthening the intestinal system.
It allows the beneficial bacteria and fungi in the intestines to multiply and be useful in a healthy way.
Regular use of kefir helps intestines function well, gets rid of intestinal disorders and reduces swelling, and gives you a healthier digestion.
A healthy intestinal system means a healthy and disease-free body.

"Kefir is also good for lack of appetite, insomnia, upper respiratory tract infections and allergies, and also helps babies to get more quality vitamins and minerals from their food. For this reason, it also has an important role in baby nutrition," he said.
Beşiktaş wants to continue from where it left off.
Beşiktaş will face Mersin İdmanyurdu tomorrow in their home ground in the 18th week of the Spor Toto Super League.
The match, which will start at 20.00 at Başakşehir Fatih Terim Stadium, will be officiated by referee Mete Kalkavan.

The black and white team, which won the last four matches before the break, aims to both extend the winning streak to five matches and continue the leadership by defeating Mersin İdmanyurdu in front of its fans.

Beşiktaş completed the first half of the season with 13 wins, 2 draws and 2 losses and collected 41 points, and it entered the break at the top, just one point ahead of its closest follower Fenerbahçe.
The sun is ideal on the field with an 11
There is an expectation that Beşiktaş Head Coach Şenol Güneş will field his ideal 11 against Mersin Idmanyurdu.

The experienced coach, who faced the second league team 1461 Trabzon twice in the Ziraat Turkish Cup and used different lineups in those games, will return to the ideal 11 in the Mersin İdmanyurdu match.

Ismail Koybasi, who had suffered a slight injury in the last match with the Black Sea representative, is expected to start in the first eleven; it is learned that Gunes plans to give the jersey to Olcay Sahin in the midfield.
Possible 11

Tolga Zengin, Beck, Rhodolfo, Ersan Adem Gülüm, İsmail Köybaşı, Hutchinson, Quaresma, Oğuzhan, Sosa, Olcay Şahan, Gomez.

In the match between Beşiktaş and Mersin İdmanyurdu, all eyes will be on German football player Mario Gomez.

Gomez, who has worn the uniform in all the matches of the first half of the league and scored goals in 10 of them, has 13 goals in the league.

He won 12 out of the last 15 matches.
Beşiktaş won 12 of their last 15 matches in the Super League.
In the league, the black-and-white team, which won one victory and one defeat in the first two weeks, won 12 of the next 15 matches, and in the other matches they got two draws and one defeat.
Beşiktaş won 6 matches, had one draw and two losses at home in 9 games, collecting 19 points.
"The one who is being eaten and the one who is eating are facing each other."
The Beşiktaş-Mersin İdmanyurdu match will bring together the teams that have scored and conceded the most goals in the Super League this season.
The black-and-whites, who scored 41 goals in the first half of the season, are the most scoring team in the league.
Mersin Idmanyurdu, which conceded 36 goals over 17 weeks, shares the last place on the table with Eskişehirspor as one of the two teams that conceded the most goals in the league.
During the first week of the season, played between the two teams, Beşiktaş beat its opponent 5-2 away in a game that had 7 goals.
There is a crisis in the technical director position in Mersin İdmanyurdu.
Mersin İdmanyurdu, which could not complete the first half of the Super League at the place it wanted, also experienced a technical director crisis during the break.

THE SECOND 'MERKEL'
The baby Angela Merkel was born on the 27th of December.

Consumer confidence in the US is at 7-month high
According to university data, UMICH increased by 0.7 points to 93.3 in January compared to the end of December.
With this result, the market expectation for the index, which recorded its highest level since June 2015, was determined as 92.9.

In his written statement, Richard Curtin, Director of Michigan Consumer Research, said, "Consumer confidence continued its rise for the fourth month with the improvement in expectations for future economic growth."
He says "Individual financing expectations have also generally maintained the highest level since 2007, due to the weakness of inflation."
The statement also contains a prediction that consumer optimism will continue to depend on inflation staying at extraordinarily low levels.

UMICH, which last year recorded its best annual performance since 2004 with an average of 92.9, is determined based on the results of a 50 question survey conducted with at least 500 people each month.

Putin is swallowing his own spit.

While Russia is preparing to grant "business with Russia" status to Turkish companies in case it cannot meet the services offered by Turkey through other means, the Russian Union of Tourism Operators has made a statement that "Russian citizens have not given up on Turkey".

The Russian Ministry of Economic Development, which calculated that severing the existing economic ties with Turkey would cost additional money to Russia, prepared and published a new "Exceptional Situations" draft for the Russian government regarding Turkey.
According to a draft published in the Russian Federal Gazette, Turkish companies and firms will be allowed to do business with Russia, even if they enter the sanctions area where necessary.

According to the draft, Turkish companies and firms can benefit from products and services in cases where it is impossible to obtain them from sources outside Turkey or where local production in Russia would entail significant additional costs.

The joint commission, to be established by the Russian Ministry of Economic Development together with other relevant ministries, will determine which Turkish products and services will be included in this category.
In this way, the bureaucrats can decide which Turkish company will be able to work with Russia by selecting them.

According to the same document, Russian state institutions and private companies will have to prove to the commission that there is no equivalent for the business they are doing with Turkish partners.
If the draft is approved by the Russian government and put into effect, privileged Turkish companies will also have registration in Russia.
The Russian Association of Tour Operators also said in a statement yesterday that Russian citizens had not given up on Turkey.

In the statement, it was stated: "Despite the travel ban and the recommendation of the Russian Foreign Ministry not to go to Turkey, our citizens have started to look for the formula of organizing their holidays on their own."
The number of articles titled 'the most practical and cheapest way to have a vacation in Turkey' on the social networks on the internet is growing rapidly.
The most common advice is to make hotel reservations over the Internet and fly with Turkish Airlines.
Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev described the fall in oil prices below $30 as a "dramatic" development for Russia.
Medvedev said, "No one thought that oil would fall to 30 dollars and it is a bad surprise for our government."
He said, "It looks like it is not possible to implement the budget in its current state."
It is the last month of the year 2015 that we have left behind.
Following the airplane downing crisis, Russian President Vladimir Putin announces that the economic sanctions will be deepened.
In those days, our businessmen who were trying to go to Russia in the usual fashion and the personnel from Turkish Airlines were suffering at the border gates.
Turkish products are dragged through customs and subjected to unimaginable controls.
Not more than a month has passed and Nerdun Hacıoğlu reports from Moscow yesterday.
One way or another, sanctions are being eased.
But why?
The reason is very simple.
In an era when the economy is so globalized, closing the border gates with a century old methods is not working out, and it is turning political disputes into economic wars.
Look, we are still writing news about how the economic embargo that was imposed on Iran for years was circumvented.
Russia and Turkey, two neighboring countries that appear to be friendly but are not really that friendly, are actually dependent on each other.
It is technically impossible to separate these two countries which are connected with businessmen, tourists, entrepreneurs, and customers even in one night.
If you close the doors, people from these two countries will enter each other's country through the chimney.
The right thing to do is to discuss political questions through negotiations at the table, without creating new Reza Zarrabs.
Without affecting the economy...

While unemployment rates rose in England, the rate remained the same among the Scots.
UNEMPLOYMENT In Scotland unemployment remained unchanged at 164,000 between May and July while across the UK the number of people out of work rose by 10,000 to 1.82 million.
According to the figures released by the Office of National Statistics (ONS), the unemployment rate in Scotland was 5.9 percent, higher than the 5.5 percent in England.
In Scotland, employment fell by 12,000 over the three months, leaving the number of people in work at 2.612 million.
The employment rate for Scotland is down to 74.0%, which is above the UK average of 73.5%.
David Mundell, the Scottish Secretary, commented on the latest figures, saying: “The government’s long term plan is laying the foundations for a stronger economy.”
It has been almost a year since Scotland decided to remain part of the United Kingdom.

Why I Was a Witness to an Execution in Oklahoma
Today I am going to watch a man being killed due to a belated legal intervention in the later hours.
I hope it doesn't happen, but if it does, I'll be sitting in the viewing gallery at the Oklahoma State Penitentiary's death chamber as Richard Glossip is executed with a lethal injection.
He wanted me to be one of the four witnesses to his death.
The invitation was first made through my best friend in January and as much as I was shocked by it, I accepted it.
As the day approached, I started to be afraid of it.
But why do I do this?
I accepted because I thought it was a good way to tell the whole story about the death penalty.
It will offer a unique perspective.
True, reporters are allowed to attend executions in America, and, because there are more applicants than available seats, there is a horrendous lottery that determines who gets to go.
Oklahoma cut the number of media seats from 12 to five.
Whoever is elected will be able to watch without falling into emotion.
I can not do it.
I'll be sitting with Richard Glossip's closest friends, and I've developed a relationship with him through phone calls over the last few months and a two-and-a-half hour visit.
I love that man.
We laugh a lot when we talk.
The officials in the prison said that I could not be both a witness and a journalist, so they would not give me pen and paper to record what I saw.
I will try to remember all of the details.
A journalist from Oklahoma accused me of compromising my impartiality via Twitter.
Here is the lesson.
Tell the prisoner's story in a way he likes, gain access.
I complained to him.
He also acknowledged that he could better articulate it, but he still thought what I was doing was wrong.
Richard Glossip does not agree with me about some of the things I have said and written.
He does not tell me what to write, and even if he did, I would not accept it.
I told him that he could remove me from the witness list whenever he wanted.
But he wants an international journalist to be there to write about it.
He thinks that if he were to die, the publicizing of it would be helpful to the movement against the death penalty.
A reporter from the Huffington Post, Kim Bellware, will be with me.
If you want to learn more about this topic, please listen to my podcast series.
I will not repeat all of the details here.
I have no definite opinion regarding Richard Glossip's innocence.
After Barry Van Treese's death, what he did was enough to make him an accomplice.
However, I still believe that he is not guilty of the murder.
I believe that there is certainly no sufficient evidence to justify the death penalty.
I think his execution was wrong.
And I will watch his death from this perspective.
I cannot claim to be truly objective.
You can look at the other reporters there for that.
The impression you would get from me would be the impression you would get from someone who had witnessed the death of a man he liked being killed needlessly.

Peter Moody has claimed the stewards at Racing Victoria tried to set him up last year and threatened to throw him out of the race if he did not leave his stable immediately.
