This really upsets me.
I will put pressure on them, and I will give them the responsibility for making decisions.
I have the support of my family and I go on my way.
The disappointment of the trainer with the ongoing cobalt investigation that included Lidari and the subsequent scratch incident caused him to say "put my license on the other side of the table."

This is a joke.

Craig Bellamy, the coach of Melbourne Storm, has responded angrily to claims from his rivals about wrestling.
Melbourne Storm coach Craig Bellamy has described the criticism aimed at his team as an attempt to "make headlines" in the battle for the NRL's two top-placed teams.
Sydney Roosters coach Trent Robinson said on Friday that referees had allowed their opponents to wrestle with their team in the semi-final in Sydney, where the Storm suffered a defeat.

Brisbane Broncos coach Wayne Bennett, after the team's semi-final win over North Queensland Cowboys on Saturday night, made an allusion to the Melbourne Storm that was far from subtle, calling their match a "cautionary tale" for the rugby league and saying the two Queensland sides were "not very good" at wrestling.
Bellamy defended his team's effort and said they focused only on "contact" while fighting.
Bellamy said that he took strength from the criticism his team received from the two leading coaches because it meant that they were concerned that Storm would beat them.
This development continues - I did not hear Trent Robinson talk about wrestling when we beat them 24-2, Bellamy said on Wednesday.

I can guarantee that we did not change anything in our defense system or in our techniques throughout the year, we just made a real emphasis on our tackling work in the last six weeks and that became a turning point for us.
Trent has been there for three years and it's obvious that he coaches a big team and probably is not used to losing.
It is also funny that this happened at this time of the year.
Bellamy took offense at Bennett's "exciting football" idea, recalling his Dragons coach who had won the 2010 St. George-Illawarra Dragons premiership by playing "boring" football.
Wayne is talking about exciting football.
Bellamy said that he made a comparison of the match on Saturday night and our match on Friday night and said that their match had been very exciting.
I remember that St George was criticized in 2010 for being a boring team, and Wayne said he wouldn't even give a rat's arse.
But now they have a team that can play exciting football, and they have young midfielders, especially with speed.
This is the kind of football you want to play when you have players like that.

He put this point on the agenda in 2010, now everyone wants to play football like that - not every team has a half-back pair like Anthony Milford and Ben Hunt, so it's not possible for every team to play like that.
This gives me more confidence, because they are talking like this because they are somewhat afraid of playing.
When they went to the big matches, they probably did not think of us six weeks ago.
Bellamy also pointed out that the Storm and Roosters match had a higher score compared to the Broncos and Cowboys match.
The Broncos' game was probably a good game, I haven't seen it yet, but what was the score? 16-12?
Our match was 20-18, both sides had higher scores in our match, but is this exciting football?
Or is it more exciting to cut down on attacks but not to make scoring attacks?
For me, this is the agenda.
If they are talking about us, that means we will meet them at a later stage.

The Serb man was released on $200,000 bail on drug charges.
The man who was caught on 40 kilograms of cocaine that was smuggled into Queensland and was facing a possible life imprisonment was released on bail for a sum of 200,000 dollars.

Marko Maksimovic, 29, was one of five people arrested last month by federal police who were tracking the 100kg of cocaine that was brought into Coomera in August on the Solay yacht that arrived from South America via Vanuatu.
Maksimovic was seen in a meeting with his accomplices in the Marina in the morning, and later met them at the Coomera Roadhouse where police found 40 kilograms of drugs in a Toyota Echo.

Despite the possibility of facing a potential life sentence for possessing a commercial quantity of cocaine, Maksimovic's lawyer said there was no evidence he was attempting to obtain any illicit drugs, and that he could have been at the cafe for an innocent reason.

It has open connections to Serbia.

Maksimovic was released on bail in exchange for surrendering both his Australian and Serbian passports, reporting to the police station every day, and adhering to a curfew between 6 PM and 6 AM.
Stevan Hogg used the girls' phones to tempt paedophiles to send images
A pedophile used an 11-year-old girl's phone to request child abuse images.
Stevan Hogg took the girl's phone when she was asleep, and he accessed a series of inappropriate child images sent to him by another user via an online messaging service.
The girl later woke up and realised that she didn't have her phone and found it in Hogg's hand while he was asleep.
He looked at it and discovered the disturbing messages before he could alert his mother.

The police took an interest and saw five pictures, and then analyzed the computers at the address and discovered "relevant" web searches that used terms related to finding inappropriate pictures of children.
Hogg later told officers that he did it to "manage paedophiles" and "act like the police and scare them."
Financial agent Eilidh Robertson told Dundee Sheriff Court: “He said this was an addiction - a frightening addiction.
He admitted that the searches were made on the computer, but he said he did so in order to act like a police officer to scare the pedophiles.
He was asked about the contact he had with the unknown person who sent him the pictures and his request that the person send him more.
He said that he did it to entice them.
He said that when he drank alcohol, he got hold of sick thoughts and wanted to watch images of rape and murder.
Ms Robertson added: "When she found the messages on her phone she screamed out to her mother and was shaking and crying.
Mom saw the inappropriate pictures on the phone, and accusations soon followed.
The girl was interviewed and she said that the defendant used a computer and a Playstation to look younger than he was.

Hogg, 23, of Ward Road, Dundee, was found guilty last year on June 14 of obtaining or making indecent images of children, breaching bail on January 25 this year, and failing to appear at court on March 24 this year.
The defense attorney, Gregor Sim, said Hogg should not be included in the sexual crimes category because there was no "obvious sexual element" in the crime.
Sheriff Alistair Carmichael postponed the case until October when a social background report would be available.
Hogg was bailed in this case but kept in custody for other outstanding cases.
Sexual crimes were recorded prior to the date of the ruling.
Robert Mugabe made an incorrect speech in the parliament in Zimbabwe.
Africa's oldest leader, Mr. Mugabe, fell down the stairs when he was coming off the podium in the early in the year.
He was not hurt, but the video of the confrontation went viral on social media.
The opening of Parliament was marred by claims that opposition MPs had received anonymous death threats if they booed President Mugabe during his speech.
Last month he was booed by the parliament while he was making his address to the nation, and they kept interrupting him - he repeated the same address on Tuesday.

The leader of the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC), Innocent Gonese, announced that seven opposition politicians received a text message during President Mugabe's speech, asking them not to disturb him.
"After Mr Mugabe's speech, messages come from a secret number, but the headline is 'death'," he said.
He says that the immunity of the members is valid inside the parliament and that the immunity does not work when they are outside of the parliament.
The party spokesman expressed that he was concerned about the threats against politicians from the party led by Morgan Tsvangirai.
Hewlett-Packard will cut 30,000 jobs.
Hewlett-Packard will lay off 25,000 to 30,000 employees in its corporate services unit as part of a restructuring and cost-cutting effort.
HP will split into two listed companies later this year; the company will separate its faster-growing computer and printer businesses from its hardware and services operations.
In a statement, HP said the expected job cuts would result in costs of around $2.7 billion by the start of the fourth quarter.

Meg Whitman, the president and CEO of HP, who will head the unit after the split, said: "these restructuring activities will deliver a more competitive and sustainable cost structure for the new Hewlett-Packard Company."

"Whitman, the new Hewlett Packard enterprise will be smaller and more focused than today's HP and we will have broad and deep portfolios to help companies move to the new style of business," she said.
As a separate company, we are in a much better position to meet the evolving needs of our customers around the world.

According to a statement from the company, Hewlett Packard Company will have an annual revenue of more than $50 billion and will focus on providing "unrivaled integrated technology solutions for businesses".

The garage in Palo Alto, known as "The birthplace of Silicon Valley" and where the company was founded by Stanford graduates Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard in the 1930s to make electronic equipment, splits the company into two.
HP is undergoing a major reorganization to cope with the shift from traditional PCs to mobile devices.

The move by HP, the world's largest PC maker and one of the biggest technology firms in the US, is one of the latest moves in the sector that reflect the belief that more focused firms perform better.
Arsenal captain Mikel Arteta says his team-mates are having problems because of Jack Wilshere's injury before the match against Dinamo Zagreb.
Wenger points out that Wilshere's injury occurred in September and his treatment is planned, and he emphasizes that there is no reason that Wilshere should not play in the Christmas period.
The best scenario is that Wilshere will definitely miss at least four games for England and it appears that his participation in the European Championship next summer is as uncertain as his past.
The most shameful thing about this latest problem is that he was able to finish last season strongly despite suffering a separate ankle injury, but then lost his sharpness in pre-season.
This type of injury is not career-threatening, Wenger said.
This is a bone that is not yet healed.
It is no big deal.
It was just an accident.
This is not related to his wrists or prior injuries.
From a medical perspective, this might be true, but as Wenger would admit, there is also a risk of a player suffering further injury if he returns midway through the season.
There is also a developing and disturbing pattern.
A survey conducted by Premier Injuries Ltd shows that Wilshere has suffered 23 different injuries since his debut six years ago.
He played in only 65 of Arsenal's 157 league games in the past five seasons.
In the big picture, Arsenal have been one of two Premier League clubs that have lost a lot of time due to injuries over eight seasons since 2007-08.
Wenger accepts there is a potential for a vicious circle, but believes Arsenal will improve on last season's record for injuries.

"Sometimes, when you come back from an injury, you go through a period where you are vulnerable to other injuries, it is a period when you want to strengthen your body and win the battle," said Wenger.
Jack is young enough to cope with that.
I hope his body will stabilize, I have faith in that and I believe that he will make the career that he deserves.

Arsenal, which will start its Champions League campaign against Dinamo Zagreb on Wednesday night, will play Chelsea on Saturday and Tottenham Hotspur next Wednesday, and Wenger is preparing his team for these games.
Héctor Bellerín and Aaron Ramsey did not go to Croatia, so it seems like Mathieu Debuchy and Arteta will play.
Wenger could also start with Kieran Gibbs and Olivier Giroud in place of Nacho Monreal and Theo Walcott.
"I try to keep the balance and give the players the breath they need," said Wenger.
Although Arsenal is one of the clear favorites in Group F, the Maksimir stadium in Zagreb is one of the most feared stadiums in Europe.
Dinamo has not lost a single match in the 41 games since they produced their own" unbeatable" campaign last season.
The stadium was shaken on Tuesday night by an earthquake measured at 3.2 on the Richter scale.
This is the 10th tremor to hit Zagreb this year.

Wenger believes Arsenal has learned the lesson from last season's loss to Monaco in the Champions League, and he continues to motivate the team with the distant goal of bringing the club its first European Cup victory.
"This motivation is enormous," says Wenger.
It has never been like this at Arsenal.
In 2006, we were very close, but on the other hand, I am experienced enough to be realistic.
We are passionate, but not dreamers.
FriendsFest: a comedy show that teaches us serious lessons about male friendship
The lack of similar programmes is striking, especially during a period when men are in more need of opening up -and suicide rates are at their highest among young men in 15 years.
In 2013, it was the main cause of deaths among men aged 20 to 45; and it was three times more prevalent among men than women.

In order to draw attention to this issue, the Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) has declared 2015 as the Year of Men and aims to challenge the culture that prevents men from asking for help when they need it.
Friendship is at the heart of this struggle to accomplish this difficult task.
A study of high school students with more than 2,000 depressive symptoms shows that if a person with this problem has a high number of "healthy-minded" friends, their chances of recovery doubles.
Similarly, a circle of mentally healthy friends can cut the risk of developing mental problems in half for those who are not depressed.
But of course, in order for a friendship to work, it has to be accessible.
In this era where social media dominates communication, they focus on style rather than content, and they make immediate response more important than meaningful communication.
Our digital lives have doubled our need to appear strong, fun-loving, and successful, even if reality starts with isolation.

Artificial success is a concept where we give priority to external values like money, image, and social status over the internal values that are more profound for our mental health such as personal development and our internal desire for friendship.
As a billionaire video game creator recently acknowledged, money does not buy more happiness.
The beauty of the Friends series was that it turned this focus upside down.
The characters were defined not by their jobs but by their personalities, and they revealed this through their interactions with their friends.

Joey and Chandler's frequent hugs, the minutes they spent watching football in comfortable chairs, Ross' relationship with Rachel, all of these were based on the fact that the men could relate to these things, even if they stood in the background for fully explaining the feelings.
This is what a helpful employee told me: "...while listening to people with depression and suicidal tendencies, I saw how the smallest interactions among friends can make a difference."
Most of the men who contact us say they cannot talk to their friends.
The feeling of "getting by" is very strong, and the idea that opening up to others is also a sign of weakness.
One of the programs that comes to my mind when I suggest long-term coping strategies is the TV series Friends.
He highlighted the small moments of male friendship.
In line with my goal, being a stranger on the phone helps people out of difficult situations, but long-term support comes from family and friends in close personal networks.
And if you attend FriendsFest on Comedy Central this weekend, why not take your friends to Central Perk for a drink in this beautiful setting, where the scenes have been newly designed to celebrate?
Or better yet, when you see someone alone in Starbucks, smile and say hello.
You never know how your friendship might make a difference.
Friends, Comedy Central is broadcasting all 236 episodes - from start to finish - for the #FriendsFest.
Di Maria made it easy for PSG to beat Malmö with his goal.
Angel Di Maria celebrated with Blaise Matuidi and Edinson Cavani after scoring a goal against Malmö.
Angel Di Maria made it easy for PSG to beat their rivals Malmo on Tuesday by scoring a goal at the beginning of the Champions League.
Here are the match report and the reactions to the match.

In a match where Angel Di Maria and Edinson Cavani were targeted, Paris Saint-Germain kicked off its Champions League campaign with a 2-0 victory over Malmö at Parc des Princes Stadium on Tuesday, a very easy and clear victory.

Di Maria scored before the end of the first half to ensure the French champions continued their Champions League campaign, but they failed to make the most of their chances until Cavani's second headed goal in the 61st minute.

Paris, in Group A with Real Madrid and Shakhtar Donetsk, needed a strong start against the Swedish champions, not just to get out of the group stages, but to improve on their quarter-final performances in the last three championships.

But while the points were theirs, this was not Laurent Blanc's team's best performance of the season, Zlatan Ibrahimovic wasted several opportunities in the penalty area, and was later withdrawn against the team of his homeland where he started his brilliant career in 1999.

"Winning in the Champions League, whether at home or away, is not easy, so 2-0 win will pose problems for our opponents, but even though there are some things we need to improve over the course of the season, a comfortable scoreline is a good start," Blanc said.
This is a good sign.
Although I am disappointed that we did not score more than one or two goals, we wanted to win and we won.

Ibrahimovic returned to PSG in one of three substitutions made by the Ligue 1 side in the 2-2 draw against Bordeaux at the weekend after his injury, but was overshadowed in the fourth minute by Di Maria.

When the Argentine winger was transferred from Manchester United last month, he was seen as the man who would take PSG to the next level in Europe, and he showed that those who thought so were not wrong with a beautiful shot that hit the net when he ran behind the Malmö defence on a pass from Marco Veratti and beat Johan Wiland from a distant corner.
However, everyone expected PSG to win a big victory, and found themselves disappointed.

Malmo, who had qualified for this tour by eliminating Celtic in the play-off, lined on the pitch with nine international players, had a five-man defense and two players in the depth of the midfield, and was a heavy opponent.
Except for a shot by Nikola Djurdjic in the 34th minute that hit the post guarded by Kevin Trapp, they had very few attacks.

On the other hand, PSG gave them the chance to slow down the game with unnecessary passes and inefficient shots, in the first half Ibrahimovic could not make the finishing move in at least five attacks and in the second half, he could not keep up with Cavani's game and created disappointment.
However, he showed that he was more skilled at organizing his teammates when he came to sending Di Maria's false shot to Wiland's goal in the 52nd minute.
The second goal came after a full hour, courtesy of Cavani, who netted his sixth of the season, heading home a cross from Maxwell on the left wing after a pass from Ibrahimovic.

Malmö's hopes of getting back into the game ran out, and after Ezequiel Lavezzi failed to score from a non-standard position late in the game, Wiland denied David Luiz a goal with a brilliant save, preventing the score from changing.
Later, Malmö coach Age Hareide admitted that PSG was one class above his own team, the Norwegian said: "Our last Champions League match was in December last year."
Since that date, we have only played in the Swedish League, which is not on the same level.
The teams in the qualifiers are not good enough.
Hats off to Paris.
It was an excellent game for them.
Glencore raised $2.5 billion from share sales.
Swiss-based mining giant Glencore took a hit from falling prices of processed goods and raised $2.5bn on Wednesday by selling shares as part of its plan to cut debts.
Glencore, listed in London, announced that it sold new shares worth 1.6 billion pounds to pay off its own debt.

The company, which has lost 57% of its market value this year, has been hit hard by falling commodity prices due to China's economic slowdown, which has caused an increase in demand and confusion in the markets.
The claim issue caused Glencore's share prices to rise in the early hours of Wednesday morning on the London Stock Exchange.
Shares rose 2.77 percent to 131.60 pence, up 0.69 percent on the FTSE 100 index.
Glencore announced a plan last week to sell $2.5 billion in shares as part of a plan to reduce its $30 billion mountain of debt by a third.
The company sold its new shares at 125 pence a piece, a 2.4 percent discount on Tuesday's closing price.
It sold 1.3 billion shares, equivalent to 9.99 percent of the group.
Concerns about China's long-stagnant growth cut iron ore prices by more than half, while coal, copper and other commodities fell between 20 and 40 percent.
The White House Confirms Xi Jinping's Visit to Washington
The White House confirmed on Tuesday that Chinese President Xi Jinping will make an official visit to the United States at the end of the month.
The statement said that Xi's first official visit to Washington would take place on September 25 and that this visit would be a return visit to Barack Obama, who visited Beijing in November.
Following the bilateral talks between the two presidents, US President and First Lady Michelle Obama will host a dinner in honor of President Xi and his wife Peng Liyuan.

The statement also emphasized that "President Xi's visit will expand U.S.-China cooperation on regional and global issues, and will provide an opportunity for Presidents Obama and Xi to address areas of disagreement in a constructive way."

It is expected that Xi will first visit Seattle before going to Washington to meet with some leaders of US technology companies, and he will then go to New York City to attend the United Nations General Assembly meeting in September.

Obama and Xi are also expected to address some contentious issues, including Washington's concerns about China's alleged cyber espionage activities and China's claims of sovereignty in the South China Sea.
Matt Damon makes diversity in film production seem trivial.
Matt Damon sparked controversy during a discussion about diversity when he said that it was not necessary to have a black person behind the camera.

In a Sunday night episode of HBO's Project Greenlight, Brown emphasized the need for alternative perspectives regarding the black lead character in the chosen screenplay, and the seasoned actor cut him off.
Damon said that when you talk about diversity, you do it in the casting of the movie, not in the casting of the show.
Shocked, Brown expresses his disapproval of this with phrases like, "Whoa! Wow. Okay," as the actor for the Martian continues his commentary.
Damon and Brown were brought together by the show's executive producers Ben Affleck and the Farrelly Brothers to discuss the finalists.
Brown first said, "I wanted to get people to think about how they will react to the Uyum character, regardless of who directs it."
The only black character is a prostitute who is shot by a white gossiper.
The producers of Dear White People insisted on finalists Leo Angelos and Kristen Brancaccio to direct the film. Damon responded to their assignment by saying that it might "turn out badly."
There was an explosion of disapproval on social media after the interview was aired.
A Twitter user, MrPooni, expressed his anger by writing, "Matt Damon calls the diversity of the only black person in the room as painful as being a white person."
After the tweet was sent, it received 5,000 retweets and 4,000 likes.
Damon's comments come at a time when the correct racial terminology is at the forefront of social discussions in the media.

After a young white police officer named Michael Brown was killed in 2014, the Black Lives Matter movement effectively encouraged lawmakers and officials across the country to stop discriminatory practices against people of color.
In February, singer Prince brought the movement to the fore when he discussed it during a presentation of Grammy nominees for Album of the Year.
Albums are still important, he said.
Albums are still important, like books and black lives.

Recently, the leaders of the Black Lives Matter movement issued a statement in response to a question from Elisabeth Hasselbeck, a prominent personality on Fox News, about whether the group should be considered a hate group.
The leaders said that the Black Lives Matter Network is a love group.
It was announced recently that Damon was included in a list of actors, producers and media moguls invited to visit the Pope in the West to discuss the definition of the Catholic Church.
It is not yet known whether he will accept the invitation or whether he will meet with the Pope.
'American Ninja Warrior' crowns its first champion
Professional rock climber and comic Isaac Caldiero became the first athlete to win the grand prize of 1 million dollars by winning the American Ninja Warrior competition on Monday night.
This competition, which is in its 7th season, has never seen a contestant complete all the stages on the obstacle course.
In the season finale, Caldiero and Geoff Britten were able to make it to the final round.
The last task was to climb a rope of around 20 meters in 30 seconds.

Britten was the first to complete the course, and in doing so became the first athlete to finish the difficult fourth stage of American Ninja Warrior; however, Caldiero beat him by completing the course three seconds earlier.
After this difficult victory, Caldiero spoke to E!News with the shock of winning the one million dollar prize.
Isaac told E! about his big raise by saying "I think it's amazing just to think about that, I have never made or lived off of more than 10,000 dollars a year."
It happened all of a sudden...I can't even imagine how it would be...the future is unknown.
Producer Kent Weed also spoke with The Hollywood Reporter about the final and revealed why no prizes were given, even though Britten was the first competitor to complete the course.
According to the rules, money is given as quickly as possible.
Weed said, "If there is more than one person who finishes, the person who finishes quickest wins the prize."
While the money was a wonderful prize and will change his life, he also won a large jackpot.
I don't think he has a bad thought about it.
He is very happy that he did what he did.
It received tons of praise from its fans.
He is a great man and a family man.
A hero in the eyes of his children and his wife.
Geoff said to me, "If anyone is going to beat me, I would be happy if it is Isaac."
I think that if the roles had been reversed, Isaac would have thought the same thing.
American Ninja Warrior has renewed for an eighth season and production will begin in the spring of 2016.
The Detroit Tigers edged out the Minnesota Twins.

The Tigers, once one of the best baseball teams, now lie at the bottom of the American Central League.
The Tigers, who had been playing poorly, managed to beat Minnesota Twins 5-4 at Target Field on Tuesday with an excellent performance.
The Twins lost their chance to rise to the American League wild card, falling more than half a game behind the Houston Astros.
For Detroit, the game represented a return to the kind of good play that's been rare for the majority of the second half of the season.

It is hard for the bench players to waste every game, so I wanted to be deeply involved in the game.
Tigers' designated hitter Victor Martinez had three hits, two of them run-scoring singles, which was his first RBI since the middle of August.
This was Martinez's first three-homer game since July 6, when he had four hits against the Seattle Mariners.

He looked good (in batting practice) and obviously was a lot better in BP, which carried over into the game.

After making a successful shot in the first attempt, Hushes took the second goalkeeper Ian Kinsler out of the game.
The right-fielder J.D. Martinez's two outs left Victor Martinez alone in the first inning.
Victor Martinez raced the runners to cross the 0-21 band in scoring position.

The Tigers added on in the second, a two-run double from catcher James McCann and a two-run single from center fielder Anthony Gose made it 3-0.
The twins' manager Paul Molitor said it "was a big hit".
He did not hit it very well, but he put it in the right place.
Hughes got three outs without allowing a run until he was replaced with right-handed reliever A.J. Achter.
Hughes was charged with three runs and four unsuccessful hits in six hits.
NOTES: Tigers RHP Anibal Sanchez left the game because of discomfort in his shoulder.
Sanchez will be examined by Dr. James Andrews, who performed the surgery on his shoulder in 2007.
Sanchez, who has been on the injured list since the middle of August due to a shoulder injury, is scheduled to begin working on Wednesday.
LHP Daniel Norris, who is on DL, will start against the Twins in Sanchez's absence.
Since the July 30th game in which David Price was traded, Tigers and Jays are tied 1-1 in their four-game series.
He has not been playing since August 20th due to pains on his right side.
The Tigers and the Twins will wrap up their three game series on Wednesday at Target Field.
Norris (2-2, 4.43 ERA) will be facing Minnesota RHP Ervin Santana (5-4, 4.73 ERA).
Xi wants to open the economy more to the world.
On Tuesday, President Xi Jinping told a group tasked with overseeing reforms that the economy needs to be more open to the outside world to accelerate growth.
The president said at the 16th Meeting of the Central Leading Group for Deepening Overall Reform that China ought to upgrade its opening-up policies by attracting foreign investment expertise.
Xi said that while encouraging opening-up, new reforms will create a new energy and vitality and provide a new space for economic growth.

The leading group accepted a series of proposals, including a negative list regulating market access, relaxing border control policies, encouraging state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to incorporate private capital, and reviewing the registration system for residents.
According to the explanation, a negative list will be prepared to define the sectors and activities prohibited for investment.
The system will be tested step by step and will be developed with trial programs.
This is an important move, because it will allow the market to play a bigger role in allocating resources and by providing a legal framework for the market, it will make the market more open.
The government will also loosen its controls on companies and allow companies to run their own affairs.
The statement also indicates that China will examine new models of cross-border economic cooperation in its border areas, and new mechanisms will be put into effect to encourage regional growth.
More areas will be opened up to private investment in order to open up sectors that are controlled by the state.
The statement said the government would not change its policy for foreign investments and would protect the interests of foreign-funded companies and provide better services to them.
In addition, the requirements for foreigners to obtain permanent residence permits or "green cards" will be optimized, and the application processes will be simplified.
The meeting also discussed the guarantee of lawyers' right to practice and the training of professional judges and prosecutors.
According to a statement released after the meeting, Premier Li Keqiang and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli also attended the meeting.
Miniature handbags are very fashionable now - Zaman Newspaper, Friday Edition
In the fashion world, all roads lead to bags.
The latest trend that came to the fore is miniature ones...
It is possible to say that the small bags attached to the adults also draw attention.
They say that everything that is small is beautiful.
I think this view is also valid for bags.
While we were walking the streets with almost suitcase-sized bags, all of a sudden the wind started blowing in the opposite direction and the bags started shrinking.
Small bags were already there, but this time they came in the form of smaller versions of large shoulder bags.
These tiny bags will only fit your phone, your credit card, and your keys.
The trend, which started with Céline and Hermès, spread with Prada.
Miniature bag obsession has also influenced the new models.
Loewe presents its fun bags this season in two sizes.
Of the different panda, polar bear, and elephant shaped bags, the elephant shaped ones stand out the most.
The mini versions of the big bags, which are presented by the luxury brands with the phenomenon names, seem to attract the red carpet celebrities the most.
Hermes' Birkin bag, which was made for Jane Birkin, is one of the most preferred bags.
Although Jane Birkin has said in a statement that she didn't want her name to be associated with a bag, it's now stuck in people's memories that way.
Fashion weeks helped to popularize the mini bag trend.
Of course, mini bags are also prominent on the podiums.
Because they're quite small, it's not really possible to attach them to your arm.
They can be used with their long straps and cross-body style.
But we have seen it more often on the podiums, wrapped around the wrists of the models.
Fendi is one of those who takes the mini-bag issue to a higher level.
Here is a suggestion for those who cannot fit their stuff in the mini bags but cannot give up on them.
Big bags for friends, small bags for friends.
How?
By turning them into a bag ornament, which can be attached to big bags.
This presentation, which is prominent on the podium, has quickly found its counterpart on the street.
Let's see what else we will see!
Leather change in denim
Turkey is at a level where it can compete with world brands in denim.
He is now enriching his design with the experience he gained in production.
Loft is one of them.
We see that black models, which were once few in number, now occupy their place on the shelves every season.
In this season when blacks have gained such ascendancy, denims have found their closest friend.
Leather pieces and leather details stand out as the rebellious friend of denim.
Generally, "motorbike" short models with zippers are on the agenda.
While black pieces complete the strong atmosphere of the skin, chiffon long blouses and shiny sweatshirts provide a sporty chic look.
In the old times, young people used to wear denim and wanted to get lost in the crowd.
It was thought to save the day.
Now, the young people want to wear a piece which emphasizes both comfort and style.
In this sense, it is possible to say that Loft has understood its target audience correctly with its collections and complementary pieces.
A small step for Banksy, a big step for 'global'
The world premiere of the "The Art of Banksy" collection, which brings together the works of the mysterious street artist Banksy, was held in Istanbul.
The exhibition, which is the first exhibition at the Global Karaköy building, includes 85 original works that are the result of 15 years of work by the artist.
The first exhibition of the mysterious street artist Bansky in Istanbul was opened at the Global Karaköy (Rıhtım Street) the other day.
The world famous artist, who conceals his identity and uses a pseudonym, was of course not present at the opening.
We do not know if he came to Istanbul.
But according to the curator of the exhibition, Steve Lazaridas, Bansky is not even aware of the exhibition.
There is no situation that requires getting permission from him.
Because the paths of old friends Bansky and Lazaridas have split up after 12 years.
Some of the works exhibited belong to Lazaridas and some of them have been collected from collectors.
But there are things that Bansky's followers are curious about.
What would Banksy think about the exhibition "The Art of Banksy", which brings together 85 of his works?
How would he react to having to pay an admission fee (35 TL) to get into the exhibition? What would he say if he saw the small store created at the end of an 800-square-meter gallery area?

Would the author of works such as The Girl With the Red Balloon, The Cleaner, and The Rose Now, which draw attention to the wounds of the world, have objected to their works being printed on tote bags and wallets and made into necklaces?
The fact that the exhibition of an artist with an anarchist soul and anonymous identity is turned into such a consumer item is a disappointment to Banksy followers.
It's not really Banksy's style.
But you should still get your tickets before they sell out!
A small but important exhibition for Banksy, and a huge one for the globalized world: "The Art of Banksy" can be visited until the end of April.
They are low and cruel.
Let them go and dig a ditch.
President Recep Tayyip Erdogan continued his criticism of the academics who signed the declaration.
Erdogan: "They are ruthless; they are lowlifes."
Because those who associate with the oppressors are also oppressors.
"They committed the same crime because they were together with those who were doing the killing", he said.

Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, who left a carnation at the explosion site in Sultanahmet, said, "We shared our regrets for the loss of 10 German friends of ours, especially in an area such as this in the Sultanahmet square, which is a gathering place for peace and history and civilization."
I would like to extend my condolences to the entire German nation and to the families of the victims.
“Our struggle against terrorism will continue with determination.” he said.

Continuing to express his reaction to the academics who signed the declaration, Erdoğan said "I especially condemn and strongly condemn the academics who published a dark declaration and signed it in the face of all these terror incidents."
The fact that one person is a professor or an associate professor does not make anyone more knowledgeable, but it helps people to know who is who in our nation.
They are dark people.
They are cruel. They are low.
Since they were with the people who committed the massacre, they also committed the same crime.
Here is the question: where will these dark academicians put the 3-year-old Mevlüde, who was martyred along with her father and siblings in the Çınar incident?
How do they justify themselves in their own conscience for standing beside his murderers?
I invite all judicial bodies, the senates of universities to their duties because of these actions which are against our constitution and laws.
Yesterday I said that the steps that need to be taken should be taken quickly.
Let them do whatever they want to do in that place.
Those who wish to do politics should do politics in parliament.
But if they cannot do it in the Parliament, then they should go and dig trenches or go up to the mountains.
I'm speaking so openly and clearly.
TEOG results have been announced.
The results of the Transition from Primary to Secondary Education System (TEOG) exams, which were organized by the Ministry of National Education (MEB) for 8th grade students, have been announced.
The results of the exam, which took place on November 25-26, have finally been announced.
Weighted Common Exam Score: The scores received for the courses in which the exam is administered are multiplied by their own weight coefficients.
The weighted average final exam score for each semester is obtained by dividing the sum of the products by the sum of the weights for the courses in that semester.
The arithmetic average of the weighted common examination scores makes up the weighted common examination score.
The scoring is done on a scale of 700 points.
The points used for placement are the sum of the year-end achievement points for the 7th, 8th, and 9th grades, and the weighted average of the 8th grade common exam.
The total is divided by two, and the number thus obtained is used as the placement score.
The scoring is done on a scale of 500 points.

'I found 26 people while I was looking for two wrestlers'
Mete Gümürhan's second documentary, "Young Wrestlers", 66.
It was the first Turkish documentary to be selected for the Generation Lplus section of the Berlin Film Festival (February 11-21).
Gümürhan, who is originally from Edirne but who has a production company in the Netherlands, explained why and how he shot the documentary, which he completed in the summer of 2014.

The documentary "Young Wrestlers" which tells the story of a school student from Amasya who is aiming to be a world champion in wrestling, will compete in the "Generation Kplus" section of the Berlin Film Festival.
Genc Pehlivanlar was the first Turkish documentary selected for this section, and it is a nominee for the Crystal Bear award.
Mete Gümürhan is a director who was born and raised in the Netherlands but is originally from Edirne.
When he was a child, he listened the stories about oil wrestling from his grandfather and watched the competitions during his summer vacations in Turkey.
"There is not only political problems in Turkey."
I wanted to tell the world about what else happened in Anatolia.
He would like to come together with six directors and make a documentary project with the thought that, "For example, our national sport, wrestling, is unfortunately not very well known."
The project fails, but one day, an article in a magazine he is reading on the plane opens the door to another project for Gümürhan.
We stayed at a sugar factory.
Mete Gümürhan follows the trace of the article talking about two young wrestler brothers who are 10-11 years old, and goes to Samsun, where the family lives.
The father of the children does not allow the filming of the documentary.
Gümürhan explains how he overcame this difficulty as follows: "I thought about what I could do all day long.
Because the Ministry of Culture could withdraw support.
Father was talking about a boarding school in Amasya where the children would go.
I got the idea of going there.
While I was looking for two children, I met 26 children who were interested in wrestling.
We started the preparations for filming in a week and completed the permissions.
We did not even have a place to stay.
"We stayed in the dormitory of the sugar factory."
The biggest challenge faced by the director of the documentary, which was completed in three weeks, was the language.

Gümürhan says that three different languages were spoken in the set where the foreign director and sound engineer were working, and he says that he did not know what he would encounter while he was shooting.
“They did not know Turkish either.” he says.
Young Wrestlers focuses on the stories of six of the 26 child wrestlers.

Baran, who was raised by his grandfather, has a weight problem; Harun, who cannot attend the training sessions because he has hurt his hand; Beytullah, who is ambitious but has some health problems; Ümit, the favorite kid of the school; Ahmet, the youngest champion; and Muhammed, who keeps the group together.
Mete Gümürhan describes his work with children as follows: "I let them be entirely natural."
I just tried to use Muhammad everywhere.
For the first week and a half, I did filming in the training sessions.
My wish was for the children to act as if there was no camera.
"Fortunately they got used to it quickly."
It was a surprise to be selected for Berlin.
Mete Gümürhan says that he did not expect Young Wrestlers to be selected for the Berlin Film Festival and says, "We were preparing but getting selected for Berlin was a surprise."
Young Wrestlers is not a sports documentary, but a production that tells about children’s struggles and shares experiences from their lives.
"I wanted to highlight the stories of children with family problems who struggle to find their identity and overcome their problems", he says.
Support from the art world and from academics

“With all our conscience and all our heart, we join our voice to the call of the academics for negotiations and peace.”

More than four hundred cinema artists including Deniz Türkali, Atilla Özdemiroğlu, Nadir Sarıbacak, Özcan Alper, Serra Yılmaz, Onur Ünlü, Yeşim Ustaoğlu, Pelin Esmer, and Tolga Karaçelik said "We are on the side of freedom of thought and art.
No buts, no ifs, no buts: “We will not be associated with this crime!”
The Peace for Academics Initiative had shown support for the academics by saying "we are with you".
The Cinema Writers Association (SİYAD) also made a statement saying "We are on the side of the academics who have been targeted by the lynch campaign."

The Academics for Peace Initiative had called on the government to make peace and negotiate in their simultaneous announcements in Ankara and Istanbul on January 11, and they released a declaration titled, "We are not a party to this crime."

As well as 1128 academics from 89 universities, the text was signed by thinkers who are well-known worldwide for their theories and books, such as Noam Chomsky, David Harvey, Immanuel Wallerstein, Judith Butler and Etienne Balibar.

President Erdoğan and Prime Minister Davutoğlu severely criticized the statement of the academics, describing it as "supporting terror", and Erdoğan called on the institutions to take necessary action.
Following this call, some universities fired academics, while the prosecutor's office launched an investigation.
Yesterday, many academics were taken into custody.
I am your fan, please help!
Hürrem Sultan's red hair, Beren's nose, Justin's hair...
While trying to look like a celebrity is considered normal to an extent, it is seen as a psychological disorder when it starts to affect one's life.
'Celebrity worship syndrome', also known as 'celebrity worship syndrome', is an academic topic that has become popular worldwide and is now being discussed in Turkey.
It can be considered normal to some extent for ladies to run to hairdressers with pictures of celebrities.
But we should not forget the year of 'Hürrem Sultan', when all teenagers were wandering around with red hair.
It was already known that 'Beren burnu' led the aesthetic operations in 2015.
The situation is not very different on the men's side.
At one time, it was a common practice to dress like Polat Alemdar.
But now an opposite wind is blowing.
Our environment is filled with Justin Bieber copies.

So much so that this unnecessary information we have cited has been read thousands of times on the Internet: "First of all, when you go to the barber, get your hair cut from the sides i.e. from the top of your ears to the top of your head."
Their sides will be short.
After the cutting process, you should shape your hair with light water.
After you have styled your hair, use the spray to fix your hair.
"It's important to style Justin's hair when it's wet."
All of this brings to mind the "Celebrity Worship Syndrome", which is a subject that has long been a subject in academia around the world, but is only now being discussed here.
Fans of celebrities are seen as a ball of love in our country.
The artists boast about the number of their fans and how much they influenced them.
Fortunately, psychology does not see the situation as so simple.
In particular, it is being discussed that teenagers decide what to eat and drink, what to listen to, what to wear based on famous people.
Excessive attachment to unreachable role models is defined as a mental disorder.
Expert psychologist Sümeyye Demir accepts that Turkey is lagging behind in its work in this field.

However, he does not overlook the fact that families are slowly becoming aware of the issue: "One of the fundamental issues of psychology is for an individual to be at peace with himself, to find peace within his own identity."
In the past, it was not taken seriously for children to fill their rooms with posters or to dress up as their idols.
This is changing now.
The parent feels the need to intervene in the situation.
"To be passionately devoted to something is a sign that something has gone wrong in a young person's life."
Fans who get on the emotional speed train
Interest in celebrities is harmless, as long as it is kept within reasonable limits.
Demir advises us to pay attention to signs like not wanting to get married, being jealous of one's spouse and preferring his/her clothes.
As the name suggests, we are talking about famous people.
It is considered normal to be curious about them and be interested in their lives to a certain extent.

But according to the specialist psychologist, the young people who lose the top of the scale are in the majority: "When there are no names in the family or surroundings that represent the child in terms of virtue and good behavior, that gap is certainly filled."
Not all examples are good.
"The child copies the negative aspects as well."
When we asked how we should approach them, Sümeyye Demir began by reminding us that celebrity worship syndrome is most commonly observed in adolescence.
When we consider that teenagers might be self-conscious, the problem is easier to overcome.

We are dealing with young people who complain about the restrictions of their families on the one hand, and on the other hand, they expect support and compassion: "We are obliged to take into account their emotional ups and downs."
New research shows that they have difficulties because of the changes that happen in their brains.
"It is natural that a young person who has boarded the train of emotional speed will get attracted to someone, and we should approach this softly."
It is possible to change behaviors.
Psychologist Sümeyye Demir reminds parents of the duties they have to overcome the syndrome of worshiping celebrities:
Recognize his emotional distress and make sure you are calm before you engage with the issue.
Never allow him to suppress his feelings.
Indicate that you respect his enthusiasm and encourage his independence.
Instead of scolding, set a good example, talk about role models.
Try to discuss the role of celebrities in our daily lives.
Reading books that tell about the real world of celebrities will be helpful.
Be sure to convert your communication to adult-to-adult format.
Just remember that addiction and motivation use the same pathways in the brain.
Share with your child that mistakes are opportunities for change and accept him as he is.
Be sure to seek expert help on the subject of fandom.
Those who get angry and those who envy also admire
At the heart of the celebrity worship syndrome is the need to get help and assistance from others.
Unstoppable love is actually a cry for help.
But unfortunately, it is not perceived that way.
Moreover, the problem is so widespread that it is impossible to confine it to one country or continent.
Dr. Recai Yahyaoğlu points out that there are certain names that occupy television in every country.
The syndrome is mostly manifested by the feelings of attachment to these famous people: "They are extraordinary."
The general majority does not have the means at their disposal.
Those who have it are unable to behave like them.
Because they either did not accept it or they did not have the courage to do so.
"But those who cannot afford to live that way, and those who can afford it but cannot live that way, continue to watch with irritation."
There is no difference between those who watch this film with admiration or with anger.
Both harbor a secret admiration of each other.
They earn money with ease, they are on the magazine agenda.
Knowing this alone is enough to increase the fan club.
At this point, another piece of advice from expert psychologist Sümeyye Demir is to question the reality of those lives.
Artificial lives should not be overlooked.
The support of the surroundings, comes into play for the person who loves a celebrity.
However, the fan does not want to accept that the famous person has problems just like him.

Should I have a gall bladder surgery? - Family - Health News - Zaman Newspaper
Dr. Fevzi Özgönül answers the questions in his column in the Meydan newspaper.
I have a stone in my gallbladder and every morning when I wake up, I use the toilet 2 or more times a day with abdominal pain after meals.
Could this be what is stopping me from losing weight?
I have been using alkaline for a while now but my appetite does not decrease, I can not lose weight.
I've been like this since my childhood.
What should I do?
Do you think I should have gallbladder surgery?
ANSWER: Most of the time, gallbladder stones are accompanied by an infection.
These complaints of abdominal pain after a meal are a sign that when you eat, the gallbladder contracts and discharges inflammatory bile into the intestines.
The intestines, which are upset by the inflammatory bile, try to quickly get rid of the bile.
This is why you go to the toilet so often.
Because you often go to the toilet, your food cannot be digested and you lose weight slowly.
In my opinion, you need to get this condition treated.
If you go to a gastroenterologist and the condition I mentioned is identified, you can get rid of it by using an antibiotic.
But eventually you may need to have surgery on your gall bladder.
Alkaline probiotics can alleviate some of these complaints, but they do not cure the complaints.
Whatever happens, I would continue using the alkaline probiotics.
Because this probiotic powder is the biggest help for you to lose weight.
I eat a lot when I am under stress.
When I am stressed and angry, I give in to food and gain weight.
How can I cope with this?
ANSWER: Excessive eating is actually a sign that energy needs are not being fully met.
This could be due to eating less or skipping breakfast and lunch.
Another reason is that you are not able to digest the food you eat.
For this, your digestive system needs to work properly.
If you don't have ulcer, reflux, or a similar problem, the easiest way is to use a good probiotic drug.
You will see the benefit of this.
I can not gain weight, doctors do not know the reason.
You usually have information on weight loss in your column.
It all sounds very logical to me, but my situation is a little different.
I can't gain weight.
Most importantly, I don't know the reason of this.
The doctors don't say anything.
The techniques we apply are not only directed at losing weight but also at regaining the physiological functioning of the body and bringing it back to its ideal measurements.
Obesity and weakness are the same kind of ailments.
Obesity and underweight are treated with the same technique.
You will lose weight even more when you eat sweet and pastry foods.
I suppose you have understood this by now.
It is possible for you to be stimulated with carboxypuncture and gain weight with healthy nutrition.
So you have moved away from your ideal body weight.
Our other patients have also started to move away from their ideal bodies by gaining weight.
You will reach your ideal body by gaining weight, and they will reach it by losing weight.
If the system problem is resolved, you will gain weight and they will lose weight.
But first of all, the system needs to work properly.

A child who feels worthless is drawn to hatred.
There are some feelings that are innate in the human psyche.
Fear, sorrow, happiness, surprise, anger, worry...
However, feelings such as hate, resentment and revenge appear in children over time, and as a result of certain mistaken attitudes.
Every person needs to be an individual, including during childhood.
That is, the parent or social environment should respect their decisions, be consulted on matters that concern them, and feel that they are valued.
Ensuring these are in place forms the basis for a healthy personality structure.

For example, making decisions on behalf of the child on issues that concern the child (what to wear, what to eat), ignoring children's wishes and imposing their own truths on them (sending a child who wants to go to a football course to instrument training) such behaviors mean not to respect the child's personality.
A child deprived of respect for his or her own identity and existence loses the freedom of being one's own self, and the defensive mechanism produces feelings of anger and hate to protect it.

Psychologist Hilal Arslan says that "Because, in fact, rage and hate are the exact opposite of acceptance." She says that by hating, the child is not accepting what is being done to him, and he is trying to tell both himself and his environment that he is valuable.

An expert psychologist says that the child's refusal to accept the situation and his reaction in response to it is a positive development in terms of his personality development. He says that the hatred here means "I am also here" and serves the purpose of preserving the child's respect for himself.
"If the child is allowed to be an individual, then hatred will disappear." he says.
The child tries to protect his own self by taking refuge in anger and hatred.

Arslan says that when children are at the most vulnerable times physically and mentally, verbal and emotional abuse by their parents and environment can cause negative feelings in the child and says that neglect can lead the child to feel invisible and not noticed.

Arslan continues with the following statement: "Sometimes this means not meeting their emotional needs (not giving them affection, not hugging and kissing them, not showing interest in their school or other needs), sometimes it also means not meeting their physical needs (food, water, shelter, school needs, etc.)"
This is a parenting attitude that opens the doors to anger, resentment and hate.
In emotional and verbal abuse, there are behaviors such as belittling, insulting, humiliating, scolding, giving unnecessary and harsh punishments, making one feel worthless, and shouting.
These behaviors touch a deep place, because they are directed at the child's personality.

"The child will either accept these feelings and lose the respect he feels for himself, and spend his life trying to fight the feeling that he is worthless and not worthy of being loved and is inadequate, or will try to protect his self by resorting to anger and hatred."

Romania is moving towards transparency in election spending
In Romania, a new law is being prepared to define the source of the money used in elections and impose an upper limit on spending.
The government wants the money donations made by individuals and companies who sponsor politicians in elections to be made more transparent.
The bill also seeks to prevent the use of 'decision money' in elections.
The bill stipulates that each party or individual must spend their election campaign money through a bank account.
This way, all the money spent can be controlled by the Romanian Election Commission (AEP) in a more transparent and orderly way.
In addition, the draft plans to introduce an upper limit on expenditures.
Keywords: Romania, election spending, transparency, Bucharest

Bahçeli will rest today.
It was announced that MHP leader Devlet Bahçeli, who is undergoing angiography in a private hospital in Çayırova district of Kocaeli, will rest today.
MHP leader Devlet Bahçeli underwent an angiography yesterday at the Anadolu Health Center in Çayırova.
A written statement was made from the hospital about Devlet Bahçeli's health condition.
In the announcement, it was stated that he had been hospitalized in our hospital as a part of a previously planned health check, just as the MHP Press Office had announced.
Coronary angiography was performed under control.
The statement was given that "His health condition is very good and he is resting at our hospital today."
MHP Kocaeli MP Saffet Sancaklı, who came to the hospital to visit Devlet Bahçeli, said in a statement, "Our general president, as you know, underwent a controlled angiography."
His health is quite good.
He will continue to rest in the hospital today.
He sends greetings to everyone.
My health is also very good, we don't have any problems.
The doctors will look at it again tomorrow.
"You know, in these situations the most important thing is what the doctors say," he said.
Attacks on journalists have become routine in Turkey.
Before the Prime Minister Davutoğlu's visit to London next week, 25 famous writers have sent a letter with joint signatures to the Prime Minister Cameron.
PEN member writers asked Cameron to raise the issue of the deterioration of press and free expression freedoms in Turkey during his meeting with Davutoğlu.

Leading writers in England sent a letter to Prime Minister David Cameron, urging him to raise the issues of press and freedom of expression in Turkey during his counterpart Ahmet Davutoglu's visit to London next week.

Twenty-five writers, including the presidents of PEN International in the UK, Wales and Scotland, wrote a letter expressing their serious concerns about "unprecedented repression of freedom of expression" in Turkey.

The writers point out that threats and physical attacks on journalists, writers and publishers have become commonplace, and they mention as examples, the attack on the Hürriyet newspaper office and the raid and seizure of the Koza İpek Media Group.

In a letter by the PEN members, who include famous British writers such as Tom Stoppard, Ali Smith and Ian Rankin, as well as Elif Shafak, it is stressed that three journalists working for the company Vice News have been arrested and other journalists have been indicted and the arrests against journalists continue.

The writers, who also noted that the detention of Can Dündar and Erdem Gül during the investigation phase of the MİT Trucks case raised concerns, said, "It is vital that journalists in Turkey be allowed to perform their fundamental duties in society, and inform the public without restriction or censorship."
He noted that the attacks on journalists, writers, and publishers erode the freedoms of all Turkish society.
He said that due to the widespread "culture of impunity," journalists and writers have been subject to intimidation tactics ranging from physical attacks.

The authors point out that the number of Turkish citizens who were charged with the crime of "insulting the president" has increased and that since Erdogan was elected in 2014, he has opened more insult cases than all of his predecessors combined.
Davutoğlu's words remained mere words.

It is underlined that Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoğlu, who will visit London next week, is one of the few government members who express support for press freedom, and it is indicated that these words did not turn into action.
The letter contains the following words: "Therefore, Davutoglu's visit to London presents an important opportunity to make a clear commitment to freedom of expression in Turkey."
The writers called on Cameron to ensure that his government respects Turkey's obligations on freedom of expression.
The 25 writers whose signatures appear on the letter:

Monica Ali, Alan Bissett, William Boyd, Chris Brookmyre, Gillian Clarke, Drew Campbell (President of Scottish PEN), Fflur Dafydd, Stevie Davies, Menna Elfyn (President of PEN Wales), Moris Farhi, Maureen Freely (President of English PEN), Richard Gwyn, Mark Haddon, David Hare, Eva Hoffman, Hari Kunzru, Robert Minhinnick, Blake Morrison, Neel Mukherjee, Ian Rankin, Elif Şafak, Owen Sheers, Ali Smith, Tom Stoppard, Sarah Waters.
Clashes spread to all neighborhoods in Cizre and 2 children were killed in the courtyard of their house.
The curfew, declared in Cizre, Şırnak on December 14, is still in force.
Gunshots and explosions have not stopped since the first day of the ban.
In the district, where there are sometimes very violent clashes, residents are leaving the district.
An explosive device hit a house in the Dağkapı neighborhood, two children, ages 11 and 12, lost their lives.
The curfew in Cizre is on its 33rd day.
The clashes between the security forces and the PKK militants have put the citizens in a difficult situation.
During the last 33 days, the citizens who live in Nur, Cudi, Sur, and Yafes neighborhoods, where the trenches are located, haven't been able to receive electricity or water for the last 33 days.
People were also forced to leave due to the conflicts in the neighborhoods where there were no trenches or barricades.
Some citizens left the district with a white flag on their cars, and the others took their belongings and moved to the surrounding cities and towns.
While clashes continued in the neighborhoods where there were trenches and barricades, the citizens here had moved to the more central neighborhoods.
However, as conflicts have broken out in these neighborhoods recently, citizens are forced to move away from here as well.
In Dağkapı neighborhood, two children, Yusuf Akalın, 12, and Büşra Akalın, 11, lost their lives when they were hit by shrapnel in their garden after an explosive hit the door of their house.
In an area of Sah Mahalle where the population density is high, 3 people were injured after an explosive was thrown at a building.
Due to the fact that the restriction lasted over a month, many citizens were in need of cash.
In the district, where all banks and ATMs are closed, citizens were forced to use their credit cards.
Citizens who do not have a credit card are in a difficult situation.
The majority of the citizens who could not satisfy their food and medicine needs emigrated.
Those who are staying in the district are able to survive with the help of their relatives and the generous contributions from Cizre.
In the district where only cases of emergency can go to a hospital, no medical intervention is available for those who suffer from toothache.
Since the large-scale operation began on December 14, education has not been provided in the district where the schools are closed.
The students who were going to take the Open Education Faculty (AÖF) exam on January 16 and 17 were not able to take the exam.
The Ministry of National Education announced the exam for students in the districts of Silopi and Cizre will be held in Mardin.

However, the students who did not want to go couldn't take the exam because the curfew was still in effect in the districts and there was no transportation to go to Mardin and the entrances to the districts were banned.
There are a large number of dead and wounded.
At least 23 people were killed and 33 injured in a bomb and gun attack on a hotel and restaurant popular with foreigners in the capital of the West African state of Burkina Faso, Ouagadougou.
In an operation following the armed attack, 126 people who were taken hostage were rescued.
The minister of security announced that three of the attackers were neutralized.
Several armed and masked assailants staged a raid on a 147-room hotel and luxury restaurant in the capital Ouagadougou on Friday evening at around 8 p.m. local time.
Five hours after the first attack, French and UN security forces located in Mali's Gao state started an operation and the first news of the hostage rescue arrived.
President Roch Marc Christian Kabore announced that at least 23 people from 18 different nations were killed in the incident and 33 people were injured.
In the operation conducted after the attack, 126 people who were taken hostage were rescued.
